Try the cashew chicken, it comes with white rice and the whole dish is just chicken and vegetables with some flavorful curry. It's not oily either. You can skip the rice and just have chicken and vegetables.

A little bit more spicy:
Beef chilli with gravy was a tad more spicy, but it was still very easy on the stomach and very flavorful.

The place seems to be very quite and off the radar. There were some old people sitting and having tea but nobody besides us was having food.

They also have great Chicken Corn Soup!

Would definitely recommend for a light lunch.
reviews.name: Shaheer

reviews.text:
Hakka Indian Chinese with a better flavor
There are umpteen Hakka Indian restaurants in the GTA. However, this outlet definitely offers better taste than most. Envoirnment is very simple and clean.
Service was great; food was even better.
Amount of food served for a lunch special at a very reasonable price is incredible.
I would prefer this restaurant above many other Hakka Indian restaurants,if it was any closer to where I stay.
A must for anyone living in the area.
reviews.name: Jittu

reviews.text:
My bf and I came here last night after work. We weren't sure where to go as it was already 930pm by the time he was off work. I found this place on yelp.. wasn't sure what to expect as there was only 3  reviews and no one inside. The reviews were good and it was open till 11 so we're like what heck ..

The venue inside was nice and clean inside, we were the only ones there. We ordered seven vegetables with cashew, manchurian chicken, and beef chilli fries rice. Water was from the tap (I could hear her pour it) and a can of diet coke. The service is like any other Asian place, you get their attention when you need it. She was quick as she was in the front  but not the type where they come ask you if you're okay every 10 mins.
Food tasted wonderful, we had lots of left overs and the overall price was about 28 before tip. 

The only weird thing was some man came In half way through our meal to order a beer. . Stared at as for a few moments then went to sit down behind us... then 10 mins  later sat at a table beside us and was pretty much staring the whole time until he was done his beer.. that was just a little uncomfortable.. not their fault ..but was still weird lol 

There was lot on the menu we still want to try.. we will  be coming back again !
reviews.name: Yvonne

reviews.text: Not really authentic Hakka food, maybe more Indian Hakka food. The Chef's Special Fried Rice is a little burned and the look of it is not very appealing. The service is good tho. But probably won't come back, there are lots more good food out there, it is just so-so food.
reviews.name: Kenneth

reviews.text:
another mission of looking for good take out in toronto. i used to live in this neighbourhood, way before all these plazas popped up (am i dating myself) and every time i come around here (which is not too often) i always seem to find something of interest. this time it is a dingy little hakka restaurant at the corner of this plaza. 

When I walked in on a week night, the place was dark and empty, save for one table of south asian men. I looked at their menu on the counter and ordered the typical dishes: chili fish, manchurian fried rice, szechuan fried beans, and manchurian chicken. We got a discount for take out. The portions were huge! both my dad and my husband loved the food. i thought they were decent too. i think the total was only $35 - great bang for the buck!

i know my husband will definitely want to eat there again next we are back in town.
reviews.name: Lynn

reviews.text:
I've been to a lot of hakka places like federicks, Lin garden, hakka work, etc... And this place stands out due to the food and value.  The pakoras here are excellent.  They are crispy, not oily at all, and full of flavour.  Portion size is also huge.  Chili chicken is also good compared to other hakka places.

I usually get takeout and it seems like the choice for most people as this place is normally pretty empty in terms of dine in customers.  You also get 10% off on orders over $30 if you pay cash.
reviews.name: Allen

reviews.text: A relatively quiet restaurant considering I had dinner here on the weekend.  Most people were picking up their take out orders and just one other table had diners.  The special combo menu had variety and a good value.
reviews.name: G.

reviews.text: Nice family run restaurant serving good tasting food with decent sized portions. The décor is a bit outdated but don't let that distract you from a variety of tasty food choices. One of the better hakka joints in the area.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: It's a small place for large groups to come and eat. The service is nice and polite usually , but today the service was a bit rude. A few customers came in and say down and the waiter didn't even notice so the customer had to go up and ask for the menu. When ordering food , the waiter questioned us for adding more to the already ordered dish in a rude , mean way. The food can be better , but overall great place.
reviews.name: Faraz

reviews.text:
stumbled upon this local Hakka restaurant while making a grocery run.

Not bad, portions are decent.  I've had better chili chicken but thats not a knock on this place.  Their rice noodle dish is good, usually other asian restaruants just fry the white rice noodles and put a saucey topping with vegetables and meats.  this place actually fried the rice noodles with soy sauce and other ingredients at the bottom..  "gong chow ngor haw" at the bottom.  and a sauce and beef on top.  quite different than anywhere else.
reviews.name: Nate

reviews.text:
Wanlee Loy is a great choice for a single diner like myself.

22 different choice of 1 plate dish for $6.99 with a pop, The selection is good for both spicy and non spicy lovers even for a Hakka restaurant, And of course I ordered mine extra spicy.

Food was cooked to order and my lunch was just hot hot and spicy hot, 

Great portion and friendly service.

Decor a little dated but feels homey.
reviews.name: Jennifer

reviews.text: These guys make some solid dishes at a decent price too ! The restaurant is unfortunately empty but I always get take-out so its hard to explain the vibe. Been going here for years as I grew up. I'd rather order from here than Tangerine.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Worst experience ever.They sre selling uncooked and raw food and they call it Indian food.When asked they replaced the same and the Indian drinks tastes like medicine,they must be expired and selling without expiry on it. Never going to return back here.
reviews.name: Robin

reviews.text: This place has the best nan bread, it's so good.  The food is authentic vegetarian Indian food.  I admit the sitting area is not too big and appealing.  But the food really triumphant that.  The value is really good too.  When ordering the Vege Thali, you don't have to order a sweet dish if you don't like it.  You can get another vege curry dish instead, no extra charge.
reviews.name: Jacklynn

reviews.text:
Yet again another amazing experience!!! Great food. Fresh. Variety. Cheap. And amazing service!!! 

I just wish I didn't have to empty my dishes into the garbage and bins. It looks gross a little. 

They have renovated since my last visit. New tables and chairs!!! But they need another TV. It's nice to watch the Bollywood actors and listen to the music.
reviews.name: Monika

reviews.text:
I've been here 5 times and don't think I want to come back again.

There are so many good thali places in GTA, I am surprised why this place is popular.

Food: 3/5 too oily, nothing special, ordinary and sadly tastes like it's been out for days and days.

Service: 1/5 a lot of shouting from servers and no greetings/manners 

Ambience and location: 0/5 way too cramped, floors are sticky and dirty, tables are dirty, it sort of kills the appetite. And it's been this way during all of my visits. So I doubt it was a one time thing.

Price: 5/5 it's very reasonably priced, but quality is what matters. I would rather pay a couple of dollars more for better food. And in all honesty in the same price range you can get better Thalis in other GTA locations.
reviews.name: Nidhi

reviews.text: Pure vegetarian restaurant. Great and tasty North Indian food. Lunch combo nominal price and tasty curries. Chaats are very nice. Paav bhaji Gulab jamun parathas badam milk are popular and tasty here
reviews.name: Meenakshi

reviews.text:
When I walked through the door, I could tell this was going to be a real authentic Indian restaurant. The food here is delicious. The sweets are fresh and the staff let's you sample before you buy. Prices and service are fair. 

If parking is full, park across the street. 

I would highly recommend it and will definitely return!
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text:
Yet again another amazing experience!!! Great food. Fresh. Variety. Cheap. And amazing service!!! 

I just wish I didn't have to empty my dishes into the garbage and bins. It looks gross a little. 

They have renovated since my last visit. New tables and chairs!!! But they need another TV. It's nice to watch the Bollywood actors and listen to the music.
reviews.name: Monika

reviews.text: My go-to Indian restaurant, I've never been disappointed. It's 100% vegetarian, affordable and delicious. Parking can be tricky. Don't let the plaza discourage you, the food is delicious and the girls who work there are very nice. They curries often times change but they have the staples like daal and palak paneer.
reviews.name: Dominique

reviews.text: Stopped in for lunch and puck some sweets. If you keep your eyes and nose close outside and make your way inside then you can find great sweets and decent Punjabi vegetarian food. There is a pan shop next door and outside is coated with people spitting that on side walks. Disgusting:( ordered a thali and you can pick which sides. Do not order puri since the one I got was cold and made who knows when. Completely deflated and was more like batura instead of puri (supposed to be fluffy but was chewy). Chana was bit hard and so was ghobi... they had some rice and attempted salad but both were not edible. Ended taking a spoon each and throwing rest away. Naan looked fresh. All in all people who miss home cooked Punjabi meal should visit. There are Ana poorna in Santa Clara with better taste yet home cooked. Sweets looked good and yet have to try them. Will visit again if the outside area gets bit cleaner.
reviews.name: Jawid

reviews.text: It's good but the staff is a bit rude. Since last 2-3 weeks I have been to this place 3 times but still the behavior is same. Food is ok. I just like jalebi and imarti that's all. Otherwise all the curries have same taste.
reviews.name: Neha

reviews.text: Ordered takeout. Everything was extremely delicious. Amazing flavours. Very good naan.  One of the best samosas I've ever had. Good service.
reviews.name: Sylvia

reviews.text: One of the best veggie Indian places.  Fast food style. It's not fancy but that's ok. Staff are happy ppl. Food is amazing. I hate the parking lot.  And the windows are always so steamy. You will leave smelling like curry. Kinda like when you leave grandmas house, lol.
reviews.name: Monika

reviews.text: My extended family catered food from here for Thatha's satyanarayana puja and his 70th birthday. Apparently this place can prepare food w/o garlic and onions for the above stated ritual. The white rice w/peas (veg pulao?), malai kofta, mixed vegetable curry, mattar paneer, and bhoodi raita were all on point. Naan looked slightly different than most of what I've seen but it was still delicious nonetheless. There are so many Indian restaurants here and in my 6-7 times I've been here over the years, it's been great to try so many of them out because they are all so tasty.
reviews.name: Vikram

reviews.text: I love to try foods from different cultures, and I found this place while on the bus and decided to check it out...I got 2 veg. Thali's for my sister and myself, we were so excited! The food was decent the plating and packaging are so neat!! And the staff are nice I happened to get extra naan so my total came up to 21$ not bad actually! The only complaints I have is that there was a pepper of some sort that was fried and I ate it and it was extremely bitter I had to spit it out, also the naan tasted sour I've never had naan like that. I was an experience and I don't think I'll be back again.
reviews.name: Nalini

reviews.text:
Looking for something greasy? Indian? Vegetarian? Head on over to Rajdhani and order a thali - an assortment of various dishes served in a silver round tray - kinda like tapas for those non-South Asians out there.

Afterwards, down it all with alot of water.

While I like this place, I'll only eat here once or twice a year, it's a greasy spoon. The decor on the inside is simple; the interior slightly awkward to navigate through - the seating arrangement is designed to maximize the most of the limited square footage. Oh, and the area this place is in ain't that pretty, so beware. 

Despite some strange affection to this place I'll only give it 2*'s.
reviews.name: Singh

reviews.text:
Its 5:30pm on a Tuesday, there are only three people in the restaurant including myself.  I ordered a veg. thali and it takes 15 mins.  to get my order.  The place is dead compared to other days.  I would expect to have my order quick especially considering the food is already made.  
I like the food here and some of the staff are nice. That's why i keep coming back but the wait time is terrible. 

I don't know the names of some of the dishes.  I guess one suggestion i could make for not just this restaurant but others similar to this is to put a label on each dish. It would attract more customers as they would not be as intimidated.
reviews.name: Leda

reviews.text:
Right on bovaird , location is convenient.
We tried twice but we're not convinced with the taste of food !

Breads were good but gravies needs attention !
reviews.name: James

reviews.text:
I love this place. It's way out of the way from just about everything but I make the hour plus transit journey frequently on weekends. The food is delicious. It's not the best Indian food you'll ever eat, but it is pretty darn tasty just the same. I live for their saag. The naan is freshly made and so good I've never bothered getting any other roti. The gajar ka halwa is also dreamy. Soooo sugary and soooo buttery. The food isn't terribly hot-spicy but I find it's increased in heat a little over the last couple of years. The excellent part is that for like 7 bucks you get three veg dishes of your choice, roti, rice, dessert, and pickle. It leaves you stuffed. Way better than most buffets for a lot less money. 

The other handy thing about this place is that you can pick up all manner of sweets to take home for your diabetic coma needs. One can never have enough jalebi or burfi in my opinion. Anyway, if you are hungry in Etobicoke or looking for a nice long bus ride then I highly recommend this place.
reviews.name: Bryce

reviews.text: Neat bright diner with simple and easy to read menus. Prices are cheap, seating area is limited compared to Brars but it's slightly cheaper and a bit less grungy looking. I ordered a veggie thali for $7.30 with tax.
reviews.name: Jessa

reviews.text:
Pros:
- Naan is amazing. Seriously good!! 
- Thali is at a great price for the quantity. Value = extremely high!
- Malai kofta was exquisite. Mushroom masala was amazing.

Cons:
- Place is pretty small. It had around 9 tables and none of them seated more than 4, unless you counted the first table which is near the main door. This table is usually avoided as cold air enters through every time someone enters the restaurant. Fix the seating arrangement/interior and EASY 5 stars!! :)
- Achari paneer was too dry and not as tasty as I would have liked.

Verdict: Takeout!!
reviews.name: Aasawari

reviews.text:
Like Singh A., I've got a pretty soft spot for this little Vegetarian dig in the seedy Albion-Islington nook. 

Thali-style restaurants fill that falafel type of fast food niche where Indian cuisine is concerned. For $5.99 you get an assortment of dishes with dessert, rice and buttery naan. Though lots of the items are greasy and 'whited out' the variety and presentation is great. Don't expect a spice-attack because you won't get it. The food just isn't that spicy. It's high on salt. 

The mango and plain lassis are made really well here, though sometimes a little too sweet for my liking so adjust your order accordingly, because they're very accommodating to requests. Customer service is great and I've repeated my visits to Rajdhani as it's a lot cleaner than its competitors nearby.
reviews.name: Roma

reviews.text: So this is pre-renovation Salad King meets Indian Food.Order at the counter, find a seat and listen for someone to yell your number. There is little to no pretension to this place. Decor and comfort are minimal. They pump out good quality Indian Vegetarian food and that's about it. Get the thali, and go nuts. There isn't a bad choice for your dishes. I'm a huge fan of their kofta. Every time I go back to Toronto this is my 2nd food stop.
reviews.name: Rohan

reviews.text: A no frills place with amazing food. We were visiting Toronto for a wedding and our group was craving snacks Indian food. Came across this place and loved everything. We were a group of 17 people and we took over half the place. Ordered almost everything but my favorite was chole bhature. Delicious soft bhatura with spicy chole heavenly. Couldn't stop eating being in New York we have yet to find a place that serves that dish so perfect. Other things were very good too, must try.
reviews.name: Payal

reviews.text:
Upon a friend's insistence we landed here one fine Sunday evening. The place is nestled away barely noticeable amidst a plethora of Indian shops. I was surprised by how unclean the carpet was. You could see the left overs strewn across trash can even before making it to register. 

Man this place is dirt cheap. And worth it. We got Thali for $6.50, Paav Bhaji for $5.50 and Ras Malai for $2.50

All good stuff. They have a big assortment of sweets at $8 per pound which I will try during our next visit. That is if I can overlook the unsanitary ambiance. And don't even think about using the washroom. Stairs leading downstairs are hazardous :(
reviews.name: Shantanu

reviews.text:
One of the top 5 places around Toronto to have good authentic Indian vegetarian food. I love the punjabi flavours they have in their dishes. Cannot beat value for money for the veg thali.

And 3 big samosas for $1 is hands down the winner if you are hungry and have no time to sit and eat.

Highly recommend their Palak paneer, Daal Makhani, Muter Paneer, Chole, Naan, Samosas and Pav Bhaji.
reviews.name: Emm

reviews.text:
Ordered catering 

Reasonable prices and really tasty food with generous quantities 

Ordered methi malai gravy, dal makhani, paneer achari with tava roti

I wouldn't recommend the naan since they get chewy if kept out for long . Sticky with tava roti which comes. Ask to make it without oil 

Cheers
reviews.name: Dinesh

reviews.text: This review is for their catering services. I was extremely impressed with Rajdhani's catering. They prepared excellent food for a fair price and also delivered the food to my home for a reasonable fee. The food was also delivered on time and packed securely so it didn't stain or spill. The food was't particularly spicy, but it was tasty. I would be happy to order their catering again.
reviews.name: Pooja

reviews.text:
Food: 3.5/5
Service: 2/5

Food was nothing special and seats (especially booths) were VERY cramped.
reviews.name: Shivani

reviews.text: I've been going to this place for well over a decade, and it's always been good! The food is spot on consistently, and the service is quite fast. The thali has always been my go-to dish but it's not the only thing on the menu. The assortment of sweets and snacks is also something which everyone must try!
reviews.name: Justin

reviews.text:
This place is not where you should take your date or go out with your friends if you want somewhere to chill or share a drink. If, however, you're in the area, hungry, looking for a place to have a bite, this is it. For $6.49+tax you'll get a big metal plate with rice, salad and 4 options of veggies. No, there's no chicken, meat, lamb, fish or any other traditional options. This place is strictly vegetarian, but man their food is tasty. Where else can you pay $7 for a healthy meal that'll leave you full? I don't know that many places in Toronto. The value for the money is unbeatable IMHO.

Today was my first time here and I absolutely loved the food. Did I mention that they sell traditional Indian sweets, which are equally good?
reviews.name: Andrei

reviews.text:
We have done a takeout from here a couple of times and it has been great. They have quite limited vegan options but having said that, they are good. We have tried Samosa Chat, Pani Puri, some of the non-dairy sabzis and rotis. The food is delicious and the portions are filling. 
The staff is quite good. Not that very friendly in a North American way but they do their job well which is pretty enough for me. 
Parking can be a problem since this plaza has a small lot and too many shops. But there may be some empty spaces in the lot on the opposite side of the road or the RBC branch next to this plaza.
reviews.name: Jay

reviews.text:
Good quality and great value. I have been coming here for over eight years and it remains one of my favourite vegetarian takeout restaurants. I'm not even sure how they're able to keep the prices so low. The Jalebis are to die for! Thank you for existing! 

P.S. the only downfall is trying to find parking in the plaza
reviews.name: Margarita

reviews.text:
My husband bought chole bhature yesterday.
While eating we saw that the bhaturas were soaked with oil approx 5 table spoon of oil in one bhatura

Very disappointed !!!
reviews.name: Roopika

name: Urban Hakka
category: Hakka, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Chinese, Indian

photos.caption: Manchurian beef noodles.  Tasty barely any beef.  Tastes like a familiar Chinese noodle dish not very Hakka or Manchurian enough for me.
photos.label: food

reviews.text: We are so happy that this restaurant has come to our neighbourhood! The chowmein is delicious as is the crispy beef, Manchurian fish, and butter chicken. We also like that they deliver!
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Probably my favourite Indian Chinese restaurant in Toronto. The service and the food, both were fantastic. I ordered the Manchurian style chicken and Chicken Hakka noodles. Delicious!!!! Just amazing. I got hot and sour soup to start with. The temperature, flavour, consistency everything was just perfect. And I ended my lunch with their mango lassi which was so refreshing with just enough sweetness. Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu.
reviews.name: Richa

reviews.text: My mom and I were excited to see a Hakka spot in this neighbourhood... Apparently it just opened a week or two ago! We walked in to a beautiful, clean, spacious restaurant and were greeted warmly and seated right away. We ordered the mango salad, crispy wontons, manchurian shrimp, and Singapore noodles, all of which were delicious! The crispy wontons were my favourite. They make their food flavourful and not too spicy, but provide two types of chili sauce for those of us that love the heat. Overall, great experience... My mom and I were really pleased with the meal and the friendly staff.
reviews.name: Radhika

reviews.text:
I was excited that a Hakka restaurant opened up in the area but was very disappointed with the portion size for take out. The portions are very small! We ordered several meat dishes and each container was barely filled half way. Most of it was filled with sauce, hardly any meat. I wasn't expecting generous portions, but something at least decent for the price we paid. 

The rice that came with it was warm, but dry and hard. 

Overall, the flavour of the dishes were decent but I wouldn't go back. It's simply not worth the money.
reviews.name: Ann

reviews.text:
We ordered this for delivery to the Yonge/Eglinton area and the food arrived faster than most UberEats or Foodora deliveries did with restaurants that were closer to us.

A week before passing by Urban Hakka we were talking about how there aren't any Hakka options around Yonge/Eglinton. They sure have the advantage of charging a premium at this location, most of their dishes are $10+.

We ordered: lollipop chicken, chilli chicken, manchurian beef, butter chicken, Singapore noodles, fried rice and stir fry bok choy. Everything tasted really good. The ones that stood out more were the chicken & beef dishes and the fried rice stood. I can't say it's the best Hakka food I've ever had but I would come back for my next Hakka craving in this area.
reviews.name: Milly

reviews.text: I ordered from the lunch special menu $10 only, got a spicy garlic tofu comes with soup,salad,spring roll and plum sauce not sure about the soup but the tofu was really good well cooked mixed with veggies yum yum definitely ordering again ..
reviews.name: Anita

reviews.text: You have to try lollipop chicken and bombay chicken. It is probably the best hakka place around this area.
reviews.name: Ramesh Bahadur

reviews.text: The restaurant is new and clean. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. The food is just ok, I'm not sure I'd ever feel the need to go back. Their Hakka game is weak. The chili chicken was lacking all the chili, I'm so confused as to why they served us chili chicken with no chili. My crispy sesame beef had more heat to it than the chili chicken. Having said this my beef was good, I'd order it again if I went back. I don't think I will be going back because chili chicken is a staple for a Hakka restaurant. If I want Chinese food I already have my go to and if I want Indian I know where to go. This restaurant is nothing special and it's also not terrible. Overall I was disappointed in this restaurant. I was excited to have a Hakka restaurant in the neighbourhood and I will still make the drive to Scarborough when I want Hakka.
reviews.name: Lindsey

reviews.text:
Great vegetarian rice ! Kind and friendly service :)))
We usually do takeout which is great.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text: Excellent delivery from Skip the Dishes last night. Chili shrimp with gravy, shrimp wontons and hakka style chow mein. All delicious, large portions, reasonably priced. Delivery was delayed by about 20 minutes but well woth the wait.
reviews.name: Raggedy

reviews.text: This place was absolutely amazing! Good lighting, intimate setting, and great food! I tried the Chilli Chicken, Crispy Beef, and the Chowmein with chicken, beef, and shrimp. All were absolutely delightful. This is my first time in Canada and this restaurant is a great first stop!
reviews.name: Kikee Auviance

reviews.text: Chicken Pad Thai was Meh. More tofu than chicken. Ordered General Tso chicken not spicy it came with extra chili peppers. I had asked for extra mild so I got extra spicy. Sent it back & it came done right. Not great value for $$.
reviews.name: Slg

reviews.text:
Absolutely shocked. Such good food.. in Midtown, impossible.

High quality food. Affordable Price Point.

Please Please Please.. Open more locations and Become very successful.

I am a Fan now.
reviews.name: Monty

reviews.text: The food was amazing! I would definitely come back here. We got here almost an hour til closing and the staff was super pleasant and helpful. Since this was our first time at their location, the waiter helped us pick delectable dishes: sesame crispy chicken, chicken beef shrimp chow menu, and the chili chicken.
reviews.name: Tameka

reviews.text:
Probably the closest to Mumbai-style Hakka Chinese I've tasted. After ordering take out a bunch of times and loving every dish we've ordered, did a lunch dine-in. 

The Bento box lunch is great value for money as well. Great eat-in experience!
reviews.name: Prasanna

reviews.text: Amazing place. Upscale feel with jazz and moderate pricing. Clean flavours and spices. A very rare spot with actual table cloths and rice dishes at the $12 mark with shrimp. Small soup is enough for 3 or 4 ppl for $5 only! For a place like this I was expecting the pricing to be higher and flavours to be more common among the dishes, but , no! They maintain quality of flavours in the food and decor. Definitely enjoyed my time and will return.
reviews.name: Mehrab

reviews.text: The food tastes just okay, pretty western taste! I would have preferred more authentic Indian. I will go and again if I'm close to the area
reviews.name: Lori

reviews.text:
We walked by this place and realized we were craving Hakka so decided to stop in. Our waiter was​ super friendly and attentive. It wasn't busy on a Sunday evening so the atmosphere was very relaxed. 

The food was satisfying! I don't know if I'd say it was the best Hakka I've ever had, but I wasn't disappointed. We ordered the vegetable chow mein, chicken wontons, and chili chicken (with "gravy"). I loved the chili chicken--definitely my favorite​ of the three.

I could definitely see myself stopping by again if I was in the neighborhood​! Would recommend if you're looking for a low-key restaurant​ with fair prices.
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Glad to finally have a Hakka restaurant in this neighborhood! Ordered delivery a few times, never been disappointed. Good food !
reviews.name: Asmeeta

reviews.text: Was here last week while on a work meeting ..we got the crispy beef and chilli chicken.   The beef was well cooked and the  chicken  was  tasty.   Wont be back  but only because I am rarely in the area ..I do recommend you try the food here if you are in the area  because it is very fresh and tasty.
reviews.name: R

reviews.text: Awesome food great staff a bit pricey but hey you are in the center of hispterville Toronto on Yonge street
reviews.name: Omar

reviews.text:
Unlike any other hakka restaurant I have been to. This one is more of a fine dine kinda feel. We ordered the hot and sour soup, lollipop chicken , shrimp green curry, crispy chicken and chicken tandoori chowmein. All the dishes were very flavorful and at The end we finished everything we ordered . 
 The presentations of the dishes were very nice and the service friendly . 
This place has been opened for over a month and I see a lot of take out orders for uber eats and skip the dish.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: This is based on uber eats. I have been complaining for so long that there are no hakka restaurants in the area, which sucks considering I grew up in Scarborough where they were everywhere. My prayers have been answered! I saw this on uber eats and decided to try two things I absolutely love from hakka restaurants: chicken and corn soup, and chilli chicken. These were both so delicious. The soup had delicious, big chunks of chicken pieces inside, and was a huge portion for a small. The chilli chicken was so flavorful, and although I do like a bit more spice to mine, it still was so delicious. The prices were extremely reasonable, especially for the area. I will definitely be ordering from here again.
reviews.name: Rachel

reviews.text:
Take-out order. Food was terrible.
Everything tasted the same, everything was just very salty, bland and black coloured. No colour or sign of freshness.
Our pakoras were raw on the inside. The Tom-Yum soup was SO salty and also had a weird sweet after taste and the garnishes in the soup were really odd. 

Won't ever order take out from here again. Even the Bombay paneer was very odd. Was a stock based sauce thickened with cornstarch. WTF. Was expecting a cream sauce. 

Almost $100 spent on garbage.
Dont get me wrong, the quantity was very nice for the price, but quality was way down.
reviews.name: Ares

reviews.text:
Initially I was disappointed because my order was delayed. Aside from this minor issue, I found that the quality and flavor of the dishes I ordered were surprisingly good. 

We ordered the following items for take-out: 
Spring Rolls Vegetables - 8/10 decent 
Chilli Chicken (Gravy) - 10/10 excellent
Rice Noodles Hakka Style (Beef) - 6/10 boring
Sesame Crispy Beef 10/10 excellent

I hope to see consistency. I will order again and update this review.
reviews.name: Neil

reviews.text: Love this place. Try the chilli chicken dry, sesame beef, lollipop chicken and Singapore noodles. So glad it opened in our neighbourhood!
reviews.name: Saba
Josh

reviews.text: Been here thrice within a month and would go back again when in Toronto! The best part is that the portion of the servings is good enough and the price is reasonable. Loved their Singapore noodles, American chopsy and veg curries options served with rice.
reviews.name: Pooja

reviews.text: We have been to this place as part of office lunch on Fridays. Place has a good lunch menu with a variety of options. Food is decent but not the best Hakka I have had in the GTA. For the lunch price it is an ok place to visit.
reviews.name: Akash

reviews.text:
This place had a very pretty in the dining area, but then the floors to the bathroom and the entire hall was sticky and greasy.

Dishes were not spicy, but the flavor was quite good. And the hot sauce on the side with peanut and oil was great! We had fish pakora and Bombay chicken. 

It's an okay place really. But i still prefer some of other hakka places in scarborough.
reviews.name: Jia

reviews.text:
We got take out from here - chilli chicken, crispy beef, tandoori chicken chow mein, Gobi Manchurian (cauliflower) veg pakora and fried rice. 

The standouts were the chilli chicken (with gravy) and Gobi Manchurian (dry). Both these had decent heat and were very flavourful. Veg pakora and fried rice were pretty good. I was disappointed with the chow mein as it didn't have that "smoky" flavour usually you have with Hakka noodles. Lastly, the crispy beef was a little more on the tough side although the flavour was nice. 

Overall the good outweighs the not so good and I would definitely return here. It's not the best Hakka food I've had before but decent. I did find the prices and portions very reasonable - we got a ton of food !
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text:
We came here for a late lunch around 1PM on a Sunday as a party of five and were seated immediately. The first thing I noticed was how spacious the interior was, with both a front and a back dining area, along with an outdoor patio that wasn't being used at that time. There were a number of other patrons and the place seemed decently busy.

We ordered the chicken pakoras, shrimp hakka style rice noodles, tandoori chicken fried rice, crispy beef, and chili chicken gravy.

The chicken pakoras came out first, and were covered in a sweet sauce. I was only used to eating the dry version, but the sweet sauce pakoras came as a pleasant surprise. I also loved how savory all the entrees were. The crispy beef was our favourite dish. So sweet. So sesame-y. So savory.

They also make their own chili oil garlic hot sauce inhouse. I would definitely recommend trying it.

It was our first time trying Hakka cuisine, but we were very impressed despite the complaints. Hakka is a great thing to happen to Toronto!
reviews.name: Vincent

reviews.text: Crispy beef, butter chicken, lollipop chicken, chili chicken.... all .. staff delightful & helpful. Highly recommend!!
reviews.name: Azhar

reviews.text:
Came by on a weekend for dinner with a few friends 

Easily the most classy hakka place I've ever been to...they obviously need to make the locals feel comfortable. I was a bit scared for the quality of the dishes as my favourite hakka places don't have 1) tablecloths 2) good service and 3) ambient music

We ordered chili chicken, chicken pakoras and Singaporean noodles. I'm relieved to say all of it is outstanding and compares favourably to my favourite east end spots. The dishes are brought out crispy and hot with a solid amount of spice. Prices were also surprisingly affordable for the location. 

They do a steady stream of takeout too, I think everyone is happy to finally have a good non-Italian spot in the neighborhood!
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text:
Solidly 3.5 stars, but I will give the benefit of the doubt, despite my price concerns, because I like having Hakka food available in the neighbourhood.

Ordered lunch for the crew through "Skip", and everything was solid. We ordered the crispy beef, chili chicken, tandoori chicken chow mein, plus veggie and chicken pakora - hot garlic style. Everyone enjoyed the food.

Pros: 
Crispy Beef and Chili Chicken we spicy and flavourful, good quality, and enjoyed by all.

Cons:
- Prices are quite high for Hakka, perhaps due to Yonge Street rent vs. Scarborough for many places.
- Chow Mein was rather bland and not extra spicy, as ordered.
- Pakora are very much on the dry side, and required a lots of sauce to rescue them, the hot-garlic sauce coating on the chicken pakora was odd, but saved them from being a total bust. Veggie Pakora were a dry disappointment. Federicks or Wong's Pakora win by a long margin.

Overall, a nice date-night location, solid food overall, but rather pricey, and skip the pakora.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: The food and portions are awesome. The staffs are friendly and the place is nice and clean. Highly recommend!
reviews.name: Viko

reviews.text:
Oh Urban Hakka... such a mixed review. Probably somewhere between a 3 and a 4.

On one occasion I dined in the restaurant and had the Tandoori Chicken Chow Mein. That meal was probably one of the best in my life - such an amazing blend of Indian and Chinese dishes. It was my first time trying Hakka and I was a true convert.

Desperate for more, I ordered take out from Urban Hakka just days later. I ordered the Cashew Chicken and was super excited because I love love love nutty chicken dishes, but it turned out to be a real disappointment, as was my partner's dish. The sauce was just blegh and I couldn't even eat it.

The Tandoori Chicken Chow Mein would keep me coming back regardless, but I'd be wary of trying new dishes here.
reviews.name: Ruth

reviews.text:
Everything was great - I want to make a special note on their Tom Yum soup ... It was the best I've ever had. In the soup, there were ingredients I've never seen, which I learned later it was 'galangal' and lime leaves. The soup was very aromatic (could be less salt), inspired me enough to search for a recipe for authentic Tom Yum. It was a work of art.

Restaurant was spacey, standard Jazz as a background music. Clean and quiet. Seemed they had lots of takeout orders, but hope more people will done in, the restaurant has a nice atmosphere.
reviews.name: Mary

reviews.text: Truly a hidden gem! Found this joint by mistake AKA Serendipity!!! Gotta have their hot & sour soup, manchurian chicken & Hakka noodles. If you pick up, you get a decent discount! Don't sleep on this!
reviews.name: Shakti

reviews.text: Amazing place to have Lollypop Chicken, also their Bombay Chicken is absolutely brilliant. For Convenient location, friendly people and out of this world taste, everyone should visit this place. Highly recommended!!!!!
reviews.name: Kabir

reviews.text:
Great Indo-Chinese food and I am so happy that it's in the city, easily accessible by TTC.

A lot of Indian friends miss and crave Indian-style chow mein but have shared that it's tough to find in Toronto, and even Brampton. Urban Hakka is the first place that seems to satisfy even the biggest Indo-Chinese food connoisseurs.

I personally like the fried rice and chow mein, both Hakka style. As well as the paneer with gravy and the chili cauliflower. 

Pro tip: get the kulfi (Indian ice cream) for dessert! The malai flavor is my favorite.
reviews.name: Natalia

reviews.text:
The restaurant is on Yonge street and finding a parking spot is a bit difficult. It has a bright board and hard to miss. Thinking it was a Chinese place seeing the "Indo Chinese cuisine" threw me off. Seeing the menu was a surprise as it indeed have a mix of both Indian and Chinese cuisines. You would find both chowmein and rice.

The restaurant is a long corridor and I find the inner most room might have some warmer tables as the front tables can get cold easily due to the doors proximity. The menu has lots of dishes so take your time to go through the menu. Our waiter was from Nepal and he was very friendly. We got some Singapore rice noodles and Chow mein. The dishes came in quick and hot. The Singapore rice noodles had a bit too much herbs in it but my friend really liked it. And I loved the chow mein - it was dry and the chicken and shrimp pieces were juicy and fresh.

Over all had a great experience at the restaurant - defined recommending. Oh btw, Yelp also gives a 10% discount when you checkin.
reviews.name: Vimal

reviews.text: very very very delicious  insane amount of flavour in the tom yum soup & hot garlic chicken pakora. 2nd time coming back, last time I also had the crispy beef which was delicious too. Good heat backed up with tons of herbs/spices
reviews.name: Jesse

reviews.text: Not bad if you're looking for your Hakka fix. We had the chilli chicken (with gravy), crispy beef (dry), shrimp fried rice, Hakka noodles (Cantonese style) and shrimp pakora. We were not disappointed. We also asked for extra spicy gravy on the side and they gave us a huge portion free of charge. Service was great and the staff had great recommendations.
reviews.name: Leonard

reviews.text:
Given the hype, I was hoping Urban Hakka would be amazing but I found it just ok overall. We got 2 dishes and, balancing out the outstanding with the not-so-good, I put this at 3 stars (though would have bumped it up to 3.5 if I could - bonus points for offering a good alternative in the area).  We got:
- Sesame crispy beef: Really amazing flavour, and the beef was properly crispy (though started to become rubbery as the meal progressed). I'd definitely order this again.
- Singapore noodles with shrimp: The noodles were a bit dry, though the faint curry taste was nice. Also not as much shrimp as I would have liked. I'd pass on this dish.

Service was attentive and personable, though a tad slow. The place itself was a bit "fancy", with white tablecloths and cloth napkins. And again, it's a different taste to other offerings in the area so hope this place lasts.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text:
I've walked by Urban Hakka a couple of times and have definitely been curious, so when we were trying to decide on a restaurant from which to order food, it didn't take long for me to choose this place.

We decided to order a couple of old standbys:

Pad Thai Chicken, Shrimp & Beef: Though this is far from the worst pad thai I've ever had - it doesn't, at least, taste like it was made with ketchup - it's certainly nothing special or worth ordering again. The big problem here is that it's just so darn sweet; I'm not sure which ingredient caused this or if sugar was added separately, but it mostly tasted like a pad thai dessert. The proteins were plentiful and cooked well, and the pasta wasn't soggy, so it was definitely edible (at least).

Chilli Beef: We chose the gravy option and this was one of the sauciest dishes I've eaten in a while. And, like the pad thai, it's fine but completely forgettable. The pervasive taste here was basil, oddly enough, and the one-note nature of the dish did ensure I got a little sick of it towards the end. It's kind of spicy, at least.

Urban Hakka needs to step up their game, because if the quality of the rest of their food is similar to what we got, it's hard to envision the place lasting much longer within this crowded marketplace (i.e. put a *little* effort into your offerings, guys).
reviews.name: David

reviews.text:
this is a hidden gem for Hakka lovers! Very close to the subway station.. and there is also street parking on Yonge. 

The restaurant itself looks very nice and divided into two sections.. so you got options where to sit and bar section in between. From the tables/spoons to customer service - everything was just perfect! 

We ordered quite a bit of food, manchurian chicken and chowmein (Hakka style) reminded me the authentic flavours of Hakka and definitely going back here again and again when the cravings are to happen for Hakka Chinese :)

Also they have quite a lot of options in the alcohol section for a good price. Overall it was a good experience, best hakka place so far in many years where food is not oily or greasy!
reviews.name: Sreekar

reviews.text:
Great little place on Kingston! I think it's been re-branded as Kingston Gourmet in the last couple of weeks. We just moved into the neighbourhood and my boyfriend and I decided to check it out to see what is was about as we saw the makeover happening. 

Happy surprise! Reasonably priced and delicious. A bit of an odd menu with Indian, Italian, and burger-fare, but delicious.

We had veggie samosas while we waited and took a margarita pizza to go. Both had a bit of a spice kick to them (I have zero spice tolerance) for me, but just right for my boyfriend (who loves spicy). I highly recommend checking them out. The owner is very sweet and nice as well.  We plan on showing more support to this little local place.
reviews.name: Liz

reviews.text: Does not disappoint!!! Amazing service and food, we just had the allo gobi, chicken biriyani and butter chicken ...... All was amazing !
reviews.name: Jax

reviews.text:
Great place and recently renovated with an updated menu (fresh fries vs frozen) that sort of tweak to make things fresh. 

Menu is very eclectic so there's pretty much something for everybody and prices are very fair.

The staff always thank you for your business which is a nice touch.

Hope the renos bring in more business for this little gem - they deserve it!
reviews.name: Stephanie

reviews.text: We've lived in the neighbourhood for years but always overlooked this spot (which has re-branded and is now called "Kingston Gourmet"). What a gem! It's tiny, but cozy (two tables for dining in, but they also do take out and delivery) and the owner/chef, Gulam, truly cares about the food he prepares. I had a fabulous spaghetti carbonara and my husband loved his lamb curry. Don't walk past this one - go in and enjoy!
reviews.name: Rachel

reviews.text:
Yelp let us down. 

My wife and I ordered from Star of Kingston using justeat.ca. We thought, based on the interviews, that the food would be tasty. We were sadly disappointed. 

I ordered the butter chicken and she ordered a napoleon pizza. Because we had a coupon we decided to get an order of onion rings as well. 

The butter chicken wasn't terrible; it was watery, and no better than what I get in a bottled grocery store butter chicken sauce, but it wasn't terrible. The portion was massive with the rice. The onion rings were cool when the food arrived (and we're very nearby!) and had a gross fishy taste to them. They were edible but not appealing. 

The pizza was a travesty. There were multiple calls between us and the restaurant because they didn't know how to make it! Apparently they changed their menu but it isn't updated on justeat, so I had to walk them through the items of the pizza. While that was annoying, it was understandable. The problem was the restaurant absolutely loaded the pizza with anchovies, to the point where the pizza was almost inedible. We threw out more than half of it. 

I can't warn people away from this place enough. Based on our experiences we'll never spend another dime here again.
reviews.name: Christopher

reviews.text: Had the fish and chips. Damn good and very nice people. Total hidden gem.
reviews.name: Hendy

reviews.text:
The food is quite good and the staff are very friendly. (Every time I order, they thank me for my business which isn't something you hear too often) Not much to the look of the place and agree with other reviewers that this place is for take out. 
We've had a few dishes including the fish and chips, BLT, burgers. They have a super cheap breakfast for around 3 or 4 bucks.  It's a little small but it's under 5 dollars, so can't really complain about the size. If you're in that area and looking for some good diner style take out, I would really recommend.
reviews.name: Orange

reviews.text:
We ordered Pizza yesterday, it was burnt and tasteless. When we called the answer we got was "that is the way it comes". I understand that the edges could be a little burnt but most of the bottom should not be.

I suggest you try somewhere else if you want Pizza!
reviews.name: Patrick

reviews.text:
Almost each time I eat there, my stomach feels bad because food is too oily and greasy (ordered pasta carbonara, veggi samosas, burger with fries at different times) but my boyfriend likes it. Breakfast items were at the very good level. Don't take apple pie. 
Prices are fine and service is fast.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text:
A fantastic little restaurant in a residential part of the upper beach. Just stopped in for appetizers,
and it was excellent. The Lobster bisque was fantastic, scallops in celeriac where perfectly cooked, frites and garlic aïoli where amazing. 
A couple of large cold Belgian beers and we were good to go. Will definitely make it back in.
reviews.name: Kate

reviews.text:
I had the pleasure of stopping in  midweek to this new location now under new management - and a friend and I sauntered in to taste some key pieces we knew were on the days menu. 

Located right on Kingston road It's the brightest gem in an otherwise low key street front resto that's just getting going - as a local charming dining experience it evokes a flair and ambiance that you'd think was lifted right out of small town Quebec - no pretentious attitude , just an empathetic passionate entrepreneurial spirit based around the love of food - and that is what drives ownership to continue to innovate and provide a flair for good eats

As it finds its voice for the local market to discover this new gem - the menu is constantly rotating and has the flexibility to cater to the changing flavours of the season - given the other dining options in the area , it's a fresh respite from the templated pub fare foods and certainly a refreshing twist on some favourites 

The Fresh Fennel and Pear salad with goat cheese has a simplicity to it that truly is delightful 

The 8oz beef short ribs with banana mash is certainly a signature piece that would warrant continued praise - I'd simply say try it and fear not be disappointed 

The butter chicken burritos and samosa is well made, flavourful and tempered with coconut milk to allow for a beautiful entree option though not truly French per se - it is a very enjoyable piece worthy of your attention and for the burrito daring crowd 

The fish and chips have a distinct batter that is both light and flavourful and served with a spicy mayo and house Aioli presented in onion cups  that pairs well with the home fries

The homemade cheesecake is in the vein of the firm New York style that was set just right for my liking and one which chef proudly will give you his history with the dessert - it is simply well paired with a well made long espresso or coffee 

I'm a fan of both effort and interest and I will say that despite any shortcomings that come with new hip restos adjusting to find their voice in a crowded marketplace   - this resto is one I'd expect to continue to innovate and have an ever evolving menu that will speak to both local tastes with a Quebec twist that's sure to please. 

I'd highly suggest your support to this local business as this is the kind of love that we should all want behind our dining experience.
reviews.name: Ravin

reviews.text: We live nearby and drive by this restaurant every day, but never stopped in until today, and we're glad we did. We ordered the oyster stew, caesar salad, short ribs and pasta of the day (penne with sausage). For dessert we got the strawberry cheesecake. Everything was so good! That oyster stew was so fragrant. And I am still thinking about that cheesecake! I only wish I had more room in my stomach so I could try more items off the menu. We'll definitely be coming back again soon.
reviews.name: Teresa

reviews.text:
Looking at this place from the outside, you might never go in.  It's tiny, and has only a few tables.  I think they make their money on take out and delivery.

An eclectic menu includes everything from pizza to pasta to fish and chips.  These Indian owners have recently added a new cuisine...Indian!

We've only ordered pasta...even for company, and have never had a bad meal.

If you've been scared off by the unappealing storefront, give 'em a call and giver a try!  It's at the north end of Waverley, in the Upper Beach.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: A local gem. It's a small restaurant with exquisite food. Tonight my husband and I split a shrimp with bacon appetizer. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and blended nicely with the bacon. For entrees, I absolutely loved my risotto with yummy fiddle heads and peas that popped with freshness. My husband's short ribs were out of this world, served with carrots, Bok Choy, zucchini and mashed potatoes flavoured with a hint of banana. Extraordinarily delicious. We will definitely go back.
reviews.name: Ganni

name: Needle and Pin
category: Burgers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Nightlife, British, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars, Indian, Bars

reviews.text:
First time guests, my wife and I shared 5 dishes from the menu and 4 specialty cocktails (classic and contemporary).
Everything was outta sight! We love this place. The environment was intimate and current without pretension. We might go back tomorrow. They have a new menu rolling out soon and we would like to try everything on this one, before it goes. We are from a large food forward city and believe Pittsburgh needs a lot more places like this.
reviews.name: Billy

reviews.text:
Was excited to try this new Indian fusion restaurant in Dormont. To start off, my one friend and I split the plate of lamb chops. They were quite overpriced as two  lamb chops were $13. 

In addition, my friend had the vegetarian curry and was not impressed. It was a dish, but not substantial at all. He is vegan, so he was really disappointed when he could tell that the meal had been contaminated by oil used in meat. He barely touched it and they didn't even take it back or get another option. After a lot of back and forth, they finally took off the vegetable curry. 

I had the tikka masala grilled cheese, which was fine. The grilled cheese was good and the soup had some hints of Indian spices. My friends enjoyed their tikka masala. Throughout the duration of our meal, three of us never even got refills on water. Towards the end our waitress became apparently hostile. Overall, their food is overpriced for the quality and quantity and their management was just not accommodating. Unfortunately, we will not be back.
reviews.name: Eva

reviews.text: We recently stopped in to sit at the bar and have some appetizers and drinks.  The food was awesome (beef Wellington bites and chili paneer). Robbie was a great bartender. Very knowledgeable and great to talk to while sitting at the bar.
reviews.name: Fred

reviews.text: I live right down the street, and this is my first time coming here. I've been missing out. The drinks.... I think we tried 8 of them... I can't say a bad thing about them. They were perfection. The atmosphere was great and the food was super good too! Between the both of us, we split 3 "plates", and 1 entree- it was a good amount of food, but a wonderful combo of everything. Will. Definitely. Be. Back. !!
reviews.name: Caroline

reviews.text: Drinks are off the hook, so nice to have a craft cocktail spot close to home! Food is Indian/British style and pretty good, but I really go here for the drinks. Bar service is very friendly and decor is cozy.
reviews.name: Missy

reviews.text: We enjoyed our dinner at Needle and Pin. Definitely make reservations if you are planning on having dinner during the weekend. The place was very busy. One downfall was that even though we had a 7:45pm reservation, they were already out of fish and chips, pani puri, and rabbit Masala. This is understandable but still a bummer.
reviews.name: Sara

reviews.text: The drinks are absolutely amazing. The food is very good but not 'off the chain good'. Somewhat cooler weather type dishes but this is expected since its English and Indian....the Impossible Meat dish is really amazing.
reviews.name: Nikole

reviews.text: This is my second time here. The first time there were moments of brilliance so I went back for more. The salad was the best ever on the first visit- so fresh and wonderful combination of tastes and textures. Tonight the salad was wilted. The tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup was also a real downer. The soup was first serve and not even warm. They took it back and it came back curdled and bland. The grilled cheese was more like grilled farm bread with a piece of cheese that stayed for a minute. I could go on but why bother. If it is a change of chefs then it doesn't bode well. All I know it will be sometime before I consider going back and spending my hard earned cash
reviews.name: Kate

reviews.text:
First of all I will say that the food was good, but small portions.

We entered and waited for over five minutes before we were greeted. We waited for our food for over an hour (only table there). No paper towel in the bathroom. Something floating in my drink. Definitely need to work out some kinks....but I expect it will be a good restaurant when that happens.
reviews.name: Jennifer

reviews.text:
I was very excited to try this place for its selection of gin cocktails and it's British pub/Indian style food.  The food was not bad, but as opposed to the interesting mix of traditional pub food with Indian spiced and flavors described in the menu, the dishes i had were just pub food with very little Indian flavoring or pub food with an Indian side sauce.  

The unexciting food aside, the service was terrible.  We were a table of two, each ordering an entree and one appetizer to share.  One entree was brought before the appetizer.  When the server was informed that we were expecting an appeziter first, she made it clear this was not her problem nor was she going to address the situation.  So one entree sat on the table getting cold while we waited for the appetizer and the second entree to be server, which was a total of about 30 minutes.  In additional the wait staff was rather inattentive and made few appearances at the table.  Because of this experience I will not be returning to this establishment for a meal.  

I would however go back for cocktails at the bar.  The gin cocktail list was unique and the cocktail i ordered was very good.
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text: Holy crap! Mouth orgasm. As a group, we ordered 5 or so dishes and shared amongst ourselves. The brunch dishes were delicious! The only sub par one was the omelette. For having only one other table to service, the food took quite a while.    To deal with our hangriness, we ordered mimosas and boy were they good.
reviews.name: Pris

reviews.text:
Our second trip back
I Love the drinks and watching an artist at work.
As much as I love the cocktails oh my gosh oh golly the food menu is incredible the chilli Paneer and the Mali Kofta wonderful delicious
reviews.name: Timothy

reviews.text: Brunch review. So excited there is a good place for drinks and non-diner food in south hills!  We went for brunch and it was pretty quiet but the drinks and food were delicious. Bread plate was amazing.  I had the curried chicken popover and it was the perfect mix of spice. Poached egg on top was perfection.  My companions ordered scotch eggs and porridge--both raved about them. Cocktails were slow crafted and thoughtful.  I can't wait to go back for dinner.
reviews.name: Autumn

reviews.text: We have tried this place a couple of time. Once for full on dinner and once for drinks and apps. The beef Wellington bites were amazing. My husband isn't a gin drinker so opted for a beer, but was wowed when he tried my gin cocktail ... yummy!
reviews.name: Linda

reviews.text:
The cocktails were excellent! I got the aviation, which I've had at other restaurants, and this was certainly the best. 
At first the concept of the menu was a little difficult to understand but basically it's a tapas bar with 4 entrees. Mostly everything was super tasty! I like the blending of Indian flavors with English dishes. The gobi manchurian.... daaaaaaamn. So good. My only complaint was that we ordered the steak and for 29$ they should've at least cooked it properly. Little over cooked. 
Our waitress was very nice and helpful. Attentive without being overbearing. 
The atmosphere is a little weird for being in the middle of Dormont so it'll have to grow on us, but the place is nicely designed.
reviews.name: Maggie

reviews.text: Excellent, creative cocktails and unusual, delicious food. A great addition to the Dormont/Mount Lebanon metroplex.
reviews.name: Bill

reviews.text: Ok, so this place just opened this weekend,  so take this into consideration.  My friends and I went here for drinks around 10 on Friday.  The cocktail menu had a lot of variety.  There weren't many people in there, but it took a really long time to get our drinks.  When we got them, the person that brought then was confused about what he had, but they turned out to be right.  They were pretty good...I had an Aviation and it tasted right.  We ordered a second round and by that time it was just us and it still took forever to get our drinks.  The atmosphere was kind of plain.  I guess I was just expecting more from a place that has such a unique concept.  The food menu looked really good, but we didn't eat.  I would definitely like to come back and eat and see what this place is like after they get a little more experience, so take this review with a grain of salt, I may change my rating after trying thus place again.
reviews.name: Erin

reviews.text: My friend and I tried this for the first time during brunch. We were really excited to try the mimosa. It was delicious, but I wish the glass was filled up a bit more. It was in a huge $8 wine glass and not even filled up halfway. We did love the aroma of the flower that added a little spunk to our drink! We decided to split the bread board which was two different types of bread, along with a really two yummy dipping sauces and some butter. We both really loved this. I ordered the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg. This is not something I would normally order, but was glad that I did. It was delicious! The portion sizes weren't big, but decent size for brunch. We also decided to order vodkas and orange juice. These were a cheaper option than the mimosas and tasted great! The bartender clearly knows what he/she is doing. The place is very decorative and cute. Staff is very friendly. Hidden gem in Dormont that we will be returning to!
reviews.name: April

reviews.text:
3.5 actually. Excellent cocktails, friendly, attentive staff. The food was a bit uneven - the scotch eggs are amazing and so is the gobi. The fish in the fish and chips was gummy and the batter was soggy, which was a bummer after how crisp the gobi were. The bangers were good but the mash was more of a potato cake, which was just OK. Lamb lollies were good but a pretty small portion - essentially $12 for what amounted to perhaps two ounces of lamb. Atmosphere cool and stylish, hard to believe how much they've transformed it. 

I will return for cocktails and small plates, probably will skip the larger plates though as they just weren't worth the spend. One suggestion I would make is to offer a bit more sauce with some of the menu items - for example, the amount of tartar sauce with the fish and chips (about a rounded teaspoon) was not enough for sharing.
reviews.name: Marcy

reviews.text:
Tried Needle and Pin on a friend's recommendation.  I am not very "adventurous" with food but tried a few dishes and enjoyed each of them! Am also not a gin drinker, but may be one now as I thoroughly enjoyed both drinks I tried. 

Loved the atmosphere, the team there is friendly and knowledgeable and appreciated a brief visit with the chef!
reviews.name: Mary

reviews.text: The bartender is a genius! Aviation is a great one--and cool shade of lavender, also loved the negroni spaticella?? Nice to have interesting veggie options. The jackfruit curry was good, the malai kofta yum, and the star of the show--the grilled cheese. Wait staff were nice and helpful as well--the note about the G and T was appreciated--it is definitely not your typical tonic. Really herbal and unusual. Hope they keep bringing out new veggie options as the cocktails will bring us back here for sure!
reviews.name: K

reviews.text: I have now been to Needle & Pin twice and have been thrilled both times.  The drinks and food are excellent and the service has been fantastic.  I look forward to my next visit.
reviews.name: Michelle

reviews.text: Second trip at 11pm: bar food was of the same caliber as dinner - good. Their bartender continued to impress. Hell or High water is quite nice even if you don't care for gin.
reviews.name: Rupesh

reviews.text: This restaurant is one of the best I've come across as far as the combination of concept and location. As someone who grew up close to the area the restaurant now is I am glad to see it in Dormont. It has an outstanding cocktail menu within which is my favorite cocktail at the moment, the Hell or High Water. The food menu is also solid, especially outstanding is the grilled cheese. A new chef recently came on board and did an excellent job. Food is great, drinks are great, design is great and the restaurant is kept clean. I work late and usually go here at night and on a few occassions have not received a welcoming feeling perhaps due to the late-night hours. However, this issue has been quickly responded to by the GM who reached out to me and I will gladly update this review upon my next visit.
reviews.name: Elias

reviews.text: Wow. Found a "needle" in a haystack;) The flavors here pop off the plate and pair amazingly with the gin creations. Highly recommend the goji Manchurian, lamb lollis, and the heirloom tomatoes. Also, have dessert if they have the macaroon. Yes you'll be full and your date will say no dessert. But, order it anyway. Incredible.
reviews.name: Darrell

reviews.text: First time checking this place out on Saturday night and it was delicious ! The drinks were awesome with a great presentation. Very interesting menu and everything we got was great. Looking forward to going back to try more items!
reviews.name: Katie

reviews.text: This is a great addition to the neighborhood. Delicious cocktails and delicious small plates. We sat at the bar and watched some really lovely looking drinks being crafted; gave me some ideas for what I want to try next.  Despite being busy, bartenders were friendly and kind enough to answer questions about what they were making.  (Seriously, there were some really pretty gin concoctions coming out of that bar.) The blackberry bramble was a nice sip. To eat, we had the malai kofta, which had an unexpectedly kicky (in a good way) sauce and the gobi Manchurian, which was light and crispy.  Next time, we'll do full dinner and I'll come back here and hopefully drop that fifth star.  Everything was reasonably priced and well executed.  Happy to have Needle and Pin in in my backyard; looking forward to a second trip.
reviews.name: Jill

reviews.text: What a wonderful experience we had at Needle and Pin! Creative dining is important to me! If you are not a brave taste tester, this might not be the culinary experience you are looking for. The atmosphere was cool, service excellent and the food was an incredible fusion of Indian with a contemporary twist!! Loved it!!
reviews.name: Stephanie

reviews.text:
GF TOOK ME FOR MY birthday  
Great food, delish drinks , and cool atmosphere!  I'm going to try and head there tonight !
reviews.name: Wendy

reviews.text: This is a great bar. They specialize in gin mixed drinks as well as Indian fusion food. I tried the impossible paratha which was delicious. Next I had the BBQ jack fruit sliders which were just like BBQ pulled pork and also delicious. Derek the bartender was very fast with the drink and food orders and explained everything about the food and drinks. I will definitely come back here when I come back to the Pittsburgh area.
reviews.name: Greg

reviews.text: Went for happy hour. Drinks were delicious and the bartender was friendly and helpful. Lots of vegetarian options for small plates, which is great to see. Basically the perfect experience for happy hour at a cocktail bar. Go here!
reviews.name: Adam

reviews.text: My whole experience wasn't perfect but the food was very good. Service could be more attentive. This place is ambitious but they pull it off. We will be back!
reviews.name: Kaitlyn

reviews.text:
A cool new place for the area! Saw the idea of the British/Indian fusion and found it very interesting! Came with a couple of friends for dinner on Friday and were very pleased. The inside of the restaurant is well lit and well decorated - cool bar areas with lots of different types of gin to choose from. We were seated quickly at a booth and ordered our drinks and dinners. I got the Blackberry Bramble which was super tasty - fruity and refreshing! I also ordered the Tikka Grilled Cheese w/ Curried Coconut Tomato Bisque (such a mouthful) while my two friends both got the Tikka Masala. The food came out quickly and was fresh & hot. The friends enjoyed their Tikka Masala - spiced well and had some heat to it! The grilled cheese & bisque was also very good! The bisque was very heavy, so even though the dish didn't look huge, I was pretty stuffed!

For dessert, the two friends got the cheesecake and bread pudding. Cheesecake came wrapped in a puff pastry thing (we nicknamed it "The Cheesecake Poof") and a side of fruit puree. The cheesecake was super soft and delicious and went really well with the puff pasty! The bread pudding was very dense and well spiced! The garnishes of cranberries, raisins, and dates were also a nice touch. 

Experience was very good overall! Service was relatively quick and very friendly. The food didn't blow me away but was definitely enjoyable, and I'd be interested in visiting again to try more dishes. A bit more expensive than a casual dinner, but a nice place to go for something a little more special. Given the unique menu, Needle and Pin would also be a great place to bring out of town-ers!
reviews.name: Shirley

reviews.text:
This restaurant definitely hits as a fit for the new "Dormont is actually kind of cool" scene.

The food is well above average, eclectic, creative, and tasty.  Some are knock-outs, and some are average.  For example, the sauce with the chick pea dust encrusted cauliflower was top-notch... the chips that went with the fried cod: mediocre at best.  But this imperfection seems inevitable when you are trying to fuse Indian and British pub food.  The real question is--will it continue to get better?

I would call the food overall a solid 7.  (I would like to note here that this is often the case for even the most "in" restaurants--inconsistency is everywere).  The drink menu, however, is a 9+.  My guest, and others in the restaurant, were loving the mixed drinks.  $10 for a lot of creativity and kick.  I was driving, so I just had a glass of wine - which was actually quite good itself.  

There is also a passion in which the servers, bartender, manager, approach the whole endeavor... I hope it is sustainable.  

Décor is nice, and a little odd - just like the food.  I think this one has a pretty good chance, if it continues to evolve and stay edgy and happy.  My advice to the owners would be to view the opening of the restaurant as the beginning, not the end, of the innovations.
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text: The bartender was very attentive and the drinks were incredible! Im not much of a gin drinker but they changed my mind. I had the curried jackfruit for dinner which was also very good, the curry was a nice mild flavor and the portion was generous. Will definitely be back!
reviews.name: Erin

reviews.text:
We tried this place last weekend for a late night dinner. The service was friendly and attentive. The lighting was a bit dark, I had trouble making out what I was eating. They are a gin bar so I tried a spicy/sweet gin cocktail. It was more sweet than spicy, and pretty tasty. 

For dinner, I had the lamb lollipops and the jackfruit curry. The curry came with thin noodles that needed a bit more sauce, fortunately the waitress brought me some extra when I asked. It had actual chunks of coconut and a good flavor. The jackfruit tasted a lot like eggplant. The lamb lollipops were a cooked perfectly to medium rare and came with a great sauce on the side. My friend ordered the spicy fried paneer appetizer, that probably had the best flavor of everything I tried. It was sweet and spicy and the paneer had a pretty strong flavor. 

My other friend had the chicken tikka Marsala. The thin noodles were a different twist on the usual tikka. Next time we will have to try the English side of the menu.
reviews.name: Megan

reviews.text:
I wish it was possible to give three and a half stars - this place really wasn't bad at all. We LOVED the Scotch Eggs and Cumin Crusted Lamb Lollipops. Tons of flavor and a great size for a small plate. 

My husband ordered the beef tenderloin and it was no bigger than the appetizers we'd just eaten. While the sweet potatoes and chili gastritis were both amazing, the beef was slightly underdone and was just far too small to be considered a main entree, especially for the price we paid for it. I understand that it's a recent trend to serve small portions, but this just left him hungry and it was not worth the cost. 

I got the seared scallop soup while and the broth and scallops were delicious, my rice was extremely underdone. It wasn't just al dente, it was crunchy and retained no flavor from the amazing broth. 

Because we were both starving, we wound up ordering beef Wellington at the end of the meal. While we're always happy to taste our way through a menu, we shouldn't have had to do this out of hunger for the prices we were paying. The Wellington was also underdone and these flavors sadly weren't there. The puff pastry wasn't cooked and left the dish soggy. And the flavor of the cauliflower (in my opinion, you may feel differently) didn't complement the flavor of the beef. 

On a positive note, the staff was very friendly and the cocktails were great. It's a Gin bar and neither my husband or I are big gin fans, but i still loved my Hell or High Water and would come back for it.
reviews.name: Meredith Blake

reviews.text: It was my one year anniversary with my wife and was utterly amazed by the extent they went through to accommodate our reservation. The newly featured food menu had choices that not only met my love of food, but especially to my wife who is vegetarian. I absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone. I also can't forget to mention the cocktail menu. Now this being said from someone who highly enjoys bourbon and scotch served net when it comes to liquor. Their mixologist/bartender has a very diverse knowledge of gin. A spirit that has been on my "I want to try, but haven't really had a reason" list. Well now because of the very very wide selection of gin varietals available at Needle and Pin, I am fully open to discovering a new found respect for gin and the variations of cocktails it can be utilized for with their creations. I know my wife and I highly loved and appreciated our one year anniversary and the many many more to come, but we will definitely be going back to Needle and Pin at a moment's notice.
reviews.name: Keith

reviews.text: This is a hot new restaurant that I've been really wanting to try! I love that it offers some Indian dishes, and the GIN! Love the lemon gin drink, but a simple dirty martini wasn't their thing. Dishes can have a kick to them! So ask if spice isn't your thing. Prices were moderate. Parking can be hard to find on the street and I'm not sure if there is a parking lot. Would I go again? Yes. But if it had to be in that area I'd check out somewhere else before going back.
reviews.name: Nicole

reviews.text:
Needle&Pin was great! It's an excellent mix of English and Indian food

Colin did an outstanding job with the interior and ambiance. 

The food is top notch-- standouts were the Chilli Paneer and the grilled cheese/coconut tomato soup. The chilli paneer had great heat and was a generous portion. The grilled cheese was made with custom bread that was to die for (so light and fluffy!) and an aged gruyere cheese. Honorable mention to the Wellington bites and tikka masala. Tons of great shareable dishes 

It's a gin bar but the manhattans were A++ 

This is a great addition to the South Hills... I can't wait to try more cocktails and other items on the menu soon!
reviews.name: Chase

reviews.text: Awesome place! Very creative menu, both with food and drinks. We tried several of the drinks and many of the items on the menu and it was great for sharing. The tikka masala with noodles was a really cool twist and absolutely delicious. Friendly staff and fun atmosphere. Highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back!
reviews.name: Drew

reviews.text: This new restaurant is exactly what Dormont needs! The building is different than all the others...you can't miss it. Inside is a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The decor is extraordinary, particularly the mosaic elephant in the back. There are little tiny lights that light up the bar-very unique and nothing like I've ever seen before. My family and I had a few cocktails at the bar to start. I've never been a big gin drinker, but this place may be turning me into one. I had the clover club to start and throughout the night made my way through the bees knees and the white lotus. These drinks seem complex to make but totally worth a little bit longer of a wait. They were amazing (see pics). For food, I had the tikka grilled cheese, the Bombay greens, and the beef Wellington bites. I thought the food was excellent and delicious and loved the presentation. You can tell they care about the tiny details. Server, Nicole, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. If these guys can pull all this off on my next visit, I will add a 5th star. Until then, cheers!
reviews.name: Tracy

reviews.text: If you enjoy great food and amazing cocktails, it's hard to find a better place in the south hills. It's a unique experience with the English/Indian fusion and the food is new an interesting. The presentation is nicely done as well. I feel the big stand out is the fish and chips, which is only available on Friday and Saturday. My favorite aspect are the cocktails. The bartenders work very hard to turn out very well crafted cocktails that are both well presented and delicious. It's also one of the few places I've been to around all of Pittsburgh that I am able to get a Ramos gin fizz. I hope you try them out!
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text:
