reviews.text: Yesterday I went during the lunch time, I ordered a veg Thali and a plate of kulcha for takeaway, I was with my wife, she was taking the food while I was for the line of sweets, I was after 4guys for my food which was done much before but for me the sweet I was 2nd in the line, one of the server she was only taking order from a man and they had being fighting over the order for a ling time and I asked the others to serve me but they kept insisting that she will serve me after she gets s done with that man and they kept taking orders from me others who were behind me, my food order was served much earlier but they kept me waiting for the sweet for no reason for long, the servers are really unprofessional and don't know how to behave with the customers
reviews.name: Abhinay

reviews.text:
Was in the neighbourhood and wanted to pick up some food for dinner and we have had some of the dishes at one of our friends place. 

Picked up 4 Thalis. Lately many restaurants will refuse to combine the 3 or 4 dishes that come with the thali. Rajdhani let us combine the four dishes that we wanted (we replaced the dessert with an extra dish/curry - most  Indian restaurants will let you do this). 

We picked up a Palak Paneer (Spinach with Cottage Cheese) - amazing dish, a must try, Malai Kofta (creamed Paneer ball in a sweet gravy) - too sweet gravy for some reason. The Chole (chickpea) hit the spot right on. Not too spicy overly seasoned and not greasy as well. And then there was Mushrooms and Paneer not seen in many Punjabi restaurants, but liked by all in the family. 

The quantity provided was plenty to eat 6 if we had enough naans, which were soft and fluffy. Ordered Rotis as well, but opening of package found that they were griddle rotis and not tandoor oven baked as they are my preferred option. Nevertheless the rotis were perfect. 

Lots of rice, salad and yogurt raita provided as well. 

As and extra thinks for appetizers we picked a few samosas and Paneer pakoras/fritters. All in all they turned out to be good as well. 

Only wish that this closer to where we live or was in an area we frequently visit.
reviews.name: Salim

reviews.text:
I work in the offices in Shoppers World and this place is  true blessing to the food court. In our area I always wondered why we didn't have an Indian restaurant on the mall...but now we have the best. Fast and fresh and  so so so so good.
Always busy but amazing prices... I am addicted. The pick and choose platter is only 8 bucks. A giant portion of rice and channa masala for lunch (no bread) is FIVE BUCKS!!! I do love the channa bhatura... just...yummmmmm.

But it's dangerous because now i can get mango lassi and gulab jamun anytime!!
reviews.name: Shannyn

reviews.text: Good halwa puri. Decent customer service. They should do more to keep the place clean.
reviews.name: Misceláneo

reviews.text: Love it for what it is!  Fast, hot, tasty cheap, friendly, and bustling.   Punjabi folks won't be crowding this place if it wasn't all that.
reviews.name: Tushar

reviews.text: I was had a plan for a movie after done eating at indian restaurant. movie show was booked for 7:15 pm bad luck I went to rajdhani sweets to eat at 5:00 pm . I was had 2:00 hours to eat. I think that's enough time to eat at restaurants but still I lost my show time because of service at restaurant there hole staff is very confused they are completely not organized and they don't know who they serving and what are they serving and the girl taking orders she always looking at clock for time to go home and she's massing up the orders after all completely bad service I'll never go back that restaurant.
reviews.name: Gopi

reviews.text:
This place was recommended by my co-worker. And since then I became a regular. Whenever I crave for Indian food I will come by after work for take out. Me and my hubby enjoy the food. Its so authentic and its cheap! Portion is decent. 

This place is always busy no matter when. And you can tell this place is so authentic so food that all Indians come here for food LOL. 

Yesterday I came here with two co workers. I had lunch already and they invited me I could not resist so I came. They were as busy as usual. The food was as yummy as usual.

Definitely a good restaurant!
reviews.name: Fanny

reviews.text: I'm not a vegetarian but it's inevitable to avoid veggie Indian food especially if your friends prefer veggie restaurants. A friend and I visited this place for a quick thali for lunch.  Price was on point at $6.99 for a thali with big helping of naan or two good sized whole wheat roti.  We also had rice, salad, Dahl, chick peas, eggplant dish, and yogurt, with a desert.  Well damn I was full and the food was super fresh and super good. Not too spicy but very flavourful and great quality! The cons: it was a single file line past a counter full of the sweets assortments but because you are kind of rushed past the sweets to the ordering spot it's hard to even think of making a thoughtful selection of the sweets to take home. The. You order and pay and are given a number. We weren't told what to do next so we kind of wandered around until someone yelled a number and we noticed someone else going to the buffet counter to pick their items.  The lady behind the food counter was rude and rushed like a drill sergeant.  When we were called up we ordered and basically we're shouted one word commands from the lady. "Veg, sweet, next, naan!?"  It was weird. Then we sat with our food and without our breads and waited. They gave the naan but not the roti and we had to ask the rude lady for the roti. So, be ready to order and be shuffled. The food was really good because I forgot about the feeling of basic training after I stuffed myself with their great feast of a thali!!
reviews.name: Vanessa

reviews.text: Great place for a quick bite. I come here for lunch sometimes. It can be pretty packed though so keep that in mind if you have a large party. I like to get the aloo paratha. It comes w yogurt and achaar (pickles). The pickles portion can be small so I do ask for extra. I've also tried the makai ki roti with saag which is a lunch special on Tuesday's I believe. The portions are big. Service can be a bit slow but that's likely due to the fact that it's so busy during the lunch hour. Food is priced very reasonably and the aloo paratha comes to about 5 dollars. They also have jugs of water at each table so you just grab a glass and help yourself.
reviews.name: Alina

reviews.text: Went to this restaurant 1st time and had a very bad experience both with food and service. Not going to back at this restaurant again. Food was disgusting. Ordered a plate of Samosas, Paw Bhaji, chaat and parathas and every thing was bad. Potatoes in the samosas was gone bad and it had a bad smell, and when I complained to the staff they said is the spices taste like that. Chaat had no flavor, ordered a mix parathas and got cheese parathas instead and cheese in the parathas had a bad taste. We are not recommending this restaurant to anyone.
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text: Extremely poor service whatever way you order it. Over the phone, they tell to come in 15 mons but when you come your order was not even punched in. When in the resturant you wait for long period till the ladies behind the counter stop talking with themselves and ask for your order. On top of this they are rude.
reviews.name: Akash

reviews.text:
I hate to write negative reviews but this time I will my stop myself. We have been at this restaurant several times. This is a self serve restaurant. You stand in a line to place your order, get a table, pick up disposable cutlery, foam glass and a water jug, and wait for your number to be called when your food item is ready. 

Prices at the self serve restaurants are usually less when compared with other restaurants with full service. You can get Thali for $6.49 which consists of 3 veggies, a dessert, salad, rice and a nan bread or two rotis (whole wheat bread). It's a decent price and food tastes okay.

However today July 16, 2015 we had made a visit to this restaurant with two other families for a quick meal. In my order I had found a plastic stripe in rice which was about 6-7cm long (pictures have been posted in the picture gallery section). While chewing my food I felts something wasn't right and when I took the stuff out of my mouth that is when I found this plastic stripe. I was disgusted and so as others on the table. Imagine how unhealthy and unhygienic it Paul's have been if I would have digested that plastic.

Sad part is when I showed the plastic found in my food to the girls at the front they called the one of their senior girl who just said it could have been from their plastic bags outside and said she could give me extra rice if I want. She didn't even apologize. I declined her offer of free rice and said thank you to her. 

At that point 6 people on the table had lost their appetite and we decided to leave the place. All 6 of them, regular customers of this restaurant, said they will never visit this unhygienic restaurant again. 

I really hope they take the cleanliness and hygiene seriously.
reviews.name: Sunny

reviews.text: As many have said, the service is worst. It seems they don't care about people walking in thru their doors. We came in at 10:40 am (place opens at 10), and we're told that food won't be ready until another 40 minutes.  Host won't  even talk straight. Seems busy doing nothing. We ended up eating pakora which were good but missed trying their food. Definitely not going back.
reviews.name: At

reviews.text:
Service is definitely bad. When you go to dine in, no one arrives to give you the menu or take your order. You must go in line and place your order and wait for your number. They forgot to update the order numbers on the screen so many people were confused. 

We ordered two mango shakes and three thalis. Our turn came to pick our food and we went. There is no dahi (yogurt) to start off with like at other Indian restaurants. They put the salad, onions, and cucumbers under the rice which makes no sense. The naan came way later and the mango shakes by the time we were done our meal. No one informed us that they were ready, we had to go about four times ourselves. The staff doesn't even ask or care. The naans were mostly very crisp and oily, not appealing at all. Most were burnt. The channa had no spices, lacking severe taste. The mango SHAKE was garbage, it was just mango juice. 

The staff doesn't even ask if you need anything else. There were unprofessional foam cups in the corner with some open straws for people to take if they were dining in. Again, had to ask and find them. We just ended up leaving without finishing our entire meals, as food and service was bad. 

BOTTOM LINE: Extremely poor service and food. Pick another restaurant.
reviews.name: Maria

reviews.text: Rajdhani is great vegetarian restaurant and sweet shop. They have vast variety of Indian sweets. My all time favourite is gulab jamun ( kind of a condensed milk tim bit dipped in rose water syrup ) and cashew burfi. I also like their samosas, they always fresh. We normally order samosas from here for work almost every week and everyone loves devouring them.
reviews.name: Damanjit

reviews.text: i spent a month in indiaast december, and i didnt have a single samosa in india that was better than the one from here. everything else was delicious too. would highly recommend!!
reviews.name: Katt

reviews.text: Oh my goodness! Talk about authentic Indian food the same way my mother does. I highly recommend the food here.
reviews.name: Fahad

reviews.text: Excellent! Food is very authentic, and delish! The owner, and head chef, came out of the back to thank me for my order, and seems to truly care about the quality of the food, as well as the service. I'm so happy I found this gem!!
reviews.name: Sara

reviews.text: Good food. The server needs to be more aware and take unwanted plates away. And I also wish the portions was bigger for the price. Kinda expensive for the small portions they give you
reviews.name: Michelle

reviews.text:
Ordered chicken tikka masala and garlic naan to go. For the chicken I give 2 stars, it was way too buttery for my tastes which is fine but it gets knocked down a bit more because of the small portion. It was about 6 thinly sliced pieces. 
The reason it gets knocked down to 1 star is because they forgot my naan. I understand mistakes will happen but for a brand new restaurant with only 2 people inside you would hope that the small details don't get overlooked. And I don't consider getting everything I paid for a small detail.
reviews.name: Willy

reviews.text:
So happy our search for good Indian in Vegas is over! The whole family loved it. We ordered mango lassis, chicken tikka masala, lamb vindaloo, a shrimp curry, and both garlic & plain naan. The chef/owner also gave us a complimentary bread pudding. Everything was absolutely delicious, but the garlic naan was possibly the best I've ever had. We've already recommended Paradise to several friends and are looking forward to many more visits.

*Just noticed that the info section says 'not good for kids.' Not sure why...we took our 11, 10, and 6 yo with us and they all loved it. They do eat Thai, Sushi, & Indian pretty regularly, however. Anyway, I'd consider this a family friendly, casual place.
reviews.name: l

reviews.text:
The food was great but it was the service that made this restaurant a standout. 

We dined at 8pm and there was only one other table filled besides ours, which was alarming, but this allowed for really personal customer service. The waiter was very friendly and made great suggestions. We had samosas(they came with delicious dipping sauces), chicken tikka masala (a classic, but I ordered it too spicy), chicken korma(a sweeter chicken coconut dish similar to curry), and garlic naan (served as one big flatbread), which were all delicious and made for great leftovers too. When we return we will go at lunch time when they have great specials on the same dishes we ordered for dinner. The owner/chef came to our table several times to make sure we were enjoying everything and he was really passionate about food and his restaurant. We can't wait to return!
reviews.name: Emmy

reviews.text: Great customer service and delicious food!!! We got the lunch special to go and it was yummy!
reviews.name: Anonymous

reviews.text: So happy that there is a great Indian restaurant  that recently opened up in the neighborhood.  I love Indian food and this place more than satisfies the craving.  This is my third time there and the vegetable pakora, shrimp biryani, lamb curry, chicken tandoori, and pistachio desert was delicious.  The atmosphere is clean and classy.  Excellent service.  I hope more people find this place because it's awesome
reviews.name: Kim

reviews.text:
Ordered chicken biriyani for takeout today. Terrible..
Lacks flavor. 
The chicken was tough. The biriyani has a weird smell. Clearly used old masalas to make the biriyani.
reviews.name: Denni

reviews.text: Very delicious Indian food! Authentic and aromatic cuisine. I tried many of the vegetarian options and let me tell you, yumm!! The best for me was the Chana Saag, chickpeas and spinach in a delicious sauce. Also the naan bread was amazing! Oh and please try the mango lasse. Best I have ever had. Enjoy!!
reviews.name: Eva

reviews.text: The wife and I tried this place a couple months ago and are hooked - we've been back 3 times.  Everything is made to order so expect a little wait - but it's worth it.  The food bursts with flavor and is obviously crafted from fresh ingredients.  The only suggestion we have is to please add a sample platter to the menu so that people can try several dishes at once.  We suggested one sample platter with poultry and the other vegetable.  If you already know what you like you're in for a treat.
reviews.name: Neil

reviews.text:
This is a fantastic spot for Indian food because everything is fresh prepared.

So if I want to remove some spices from my food, like cumin seeds (which are junk because they irritate the digestive tract), then it's no big deal. Almost all the other Indian places in town premix things several days in advance which means the food at these other places isn't truly fresh.

I also like the variety of choices on the menu and it's also rare to find Indian spots with dosa.

Service is very attentive and friendly.

Keep up the good work!
reviews.name: Goo

reviews.text: Excellent experience here. Friendly staff and nice location.  I love Indian food and I brought my parents here for their first Indian food experience. We got several different things to try a lot of the menu. It was all delicious. We are all happy with the food and experience. The owner/cook even came out to check on what we thought. He was very kind and we appreciated him coming to say hello.  I would come here again soon if I weren't just here on vacation.  I would recommend this place for sure!!
reviews.name: Carissa

reviews.text: We've know William the owner for some time now and still find Paradise India to be the best authentic Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. William has a great Vegetarian and Non Vegetarian lunch special, perfectly delicious and at a great price. We come here once a week for our Indian treat! This particular visit instead of the lunch special I wanted to have the Chicken curry again. However I wanted the authentic Indian version, not the Westernized cubed chicken breast version. See I grew up true Indian food with close family Indian friends and have come to love a true authentic Chicken curry made with Chicken pieces chopped up with a clever, chicken skin, bones and all. I asked William the owner chef if he could make the chicken curry this way for me, surprised by my request he said that's how they have it at home and that's the true way to prepare it, however to make it more commercially acceptable they make it it with chicken breast cubed in the restaurant. William was more than happy to prepare the meal for me the authentic way and got right to it, and by the looks of it, happy to accommodate my request, even down to the spice level I required. While William was whipping up my special request we started with a truly delicious hot and spicy crispy crunchy flaky Samosa filled with a curry potato and pea filling appetizer served with a delicious mint sauce and tamarin sauce. James had the non vegetarian lunch special, Chicken Tikka Masala & Chicken  Korma served with rice. William brought out my chicken curry and it was absolutely superb! The authentic way with chopped chicken pieces has so much more flavor! I enjoyed it so much! Taking me back to my aunty Priscilla's chicken table 20 years back. Only when something is truly authentic will it transport you back in time to a childhood kitchen table where one was enjoying the real deal, and take it from me, William's Indian cuisine is as real as it gets!
reviews.name: Johan

reviews.text: 2 reasons why I'm leaving a 3 star review , or else I would've left a 2 star. Our server was really nice & the tikka Marsala was pretty good. Now the reasons why I'm rating this place so low. #1 we were the only table in the restaurant besides 2 take outs yesterday night. Our food took almost 30 min to get to the table. #2 even though the Marsala tasted pretty good, the portion was so small & there was literally 8 chopped up pieces of chicken in the 16 oz bowl which we paid 16 bucks for. #3 we ordered the paradise special platter that had 5 little ass pieces of different types of chicken, a little piece of fish , 2 quarter sized pieces of lamb, & 2 nickel sized shrimps, which we paid 25 bucks for. None of which had any flavor but we managed to eat it because we dipped everything in the Marsala sauce while we forced ourselves to eat. #4 we ordered saffron rice which is suppose to be more flavorful but it literally tasted like salty rice. 6 bucks for that. So portions were definitely not worth the price. Especially when the food wasn't very tasty. Chicken tikki Marsala would have been worth it if we had more then 8 little cubes of meat.
reviews.name: Vid

reviews.text: Yummy! Yummy! Super flavorful food. The chef and owner, William was super nice. The service was quick and effective. The Lunch buffet is to die for. Completely recommend it.
reviews.name: Dacyl

reviews.text:
Trued the buffet today and was very dissatisfied. 
The taste of whatever was left in the buffet was ok, but refills were few abd far between. I didn't even try it all because there just wasn't enough. 
Also front house service needs work. Sone only needed to great and seat us unsteady of me looking for the host abd asking to be seated. 
They gave a lot to work on. 
Hoping they get better and I may visit again in the future.
reviews.name: Vibe

reviews.text: Drove out here because the hours listed that it was open at 3:20 pm. Was extremely frustrated to find that despite the hours listed on Yelp, and their own door, the restaurant had a paper sign up reading closed 3-5pm. Extremely frustrated as I drove out of my way to try this restaurant out.
reviews.name: Athena

reviews.text: Awesome food will definitely go back once I get back to Vegas Biryani was off the hook thanks.
reviews.name: Shamal

reviews.text: The review is from a Mothers day lunch at the restaurant. Selected the restaurant based on other glowing reviews. The experience was quite the opposite. The food choices were limited and the quality was bad. Our group left most of the food after tasting it. Will not be visiting again. Very disappointed.
reviews.name: Harry

reviews.text: Nice place and pleasant atmosphere.  We had the samosas for an appetizer and they were very tasty. Our dinner was very good we had the chicken tikki masala, tandoor chicken, saffron rice and the garlic and plain naan bread. Everything was well prepared and there was plenty of food. Definitely would recommend this place.
reviews.name: Nina

reviews.text:
By far this is the best India food in Vegas.  I always searching for the best and now I know I've found it.  Family owned and operated, the recipes are delicious!  

The lunch specials are bomb!  Fair price and a whole bunch of food.  It's a true lunch special they don't skimp you on size at all.

The naan here is the best naan I've had anywhere hands down!!! 

The best thing about the place is they are willing to cook my meals in butter.  I avoid veggie oil so it's nice to have a place I can go out to eat. The butter cooked meals fill the whole restaurant in a wonderful fragrance.
reviews.name: Evan

reviews.text:
Came in for lunch with co-workers. Service was very slow and server only carried one plate at a time to the table even though they were all up and ready at the same time. Took forever to get the check and ended up late being back to lunch.  Forget about refills on drinks.  

Added this Edit after posting:  I love how the owner/chef Ric N. just "laughed" and my review and all the other bad reviews instead of trying to make the experience right.  Not good customer service. Oh and gave his own restaurant a positive review as a customer as if we wouldn't notice.
reviews.name: Dave

reviews.text: Paradise India is the finest Indian food I've had. My dinner mate was in complete agreement. The flavors are authentic and unique. I had the lamb and mushroom and it was delicious. A gem in Las Vegas.
reviews.name: George

reviews.text: The food was excellent and the chef waited on us and even explained the menu questions we had. Would HIGHLY recommend!  I expect they will do very well!!
reviews.name: Markie

reviews.text: The food was fantastic and the owners were amazing. I just moved to Las Vegas and the owner spent time to answer my questions about living in the area and made sure I was well advised. The chef is very talented and the quality of his food spoke for how much care he puts into his cooking. Highly recommend to everybody!
reviews.name: Rithwik

reviews.text: Love coming here! The garlic naan is so good! And there tikka masala is so fresh and delicious! Also love there tamarind sauce with rice! And the mango lassi! It's definitely worth the try!
reviews.name: Ela

reviews.text: We had a wonderful meal here. William, the owner and chef, was very friendly. We had the fish Vindaloo that was outstanding. Nice samosas and a good lassi with a hint of cardamom. He also offers some good lunch specials like three vegetables for $8.99. We will be back.
reviews.name: Katherine

reviews.text: I work next door and have been waiting for it to open.  Worth the wait!   The lunch special is amazing.  I thought it couldn't get better than their Tikka Masala, then tried the Korma! Wow!  I go at least once a week now.
reviews.name: Jim

reviews.text: This was my favorite Indian spot when the location was on sahara and cimmaron. I was sad when I thought they closed. But now they moved to a place closer to my house! So thats amazing! Im so relieved! Definitely still my favorite. I just ordered online, and the biryani is still amazing. My experience was always good before. I miss the mango lassi! Thank you for making amazing food. I will definitely be a regular customer.
reviews.name: Christina

reviews.text:
I've been here two days in a row with
my husband, this place is amazing, not sure why it's not busier. We wanted a dish that was not on the menu so the chef made it specifically for us, It was to our standards. The dishes has all the flavors and it's spiced to perfection. 

The owner is an amazing individual who clearly ensures that the food is of the utmost quality. 
He even came to our table to make sure we were satisfied with our food. 


Thank you for the great experienced. 

P.S 
The Garlic Naan is awesome!
reviews.name: Senna

reviews.text: One of my favorite places and favorite people that run it. All of the food is perfectly prepared with love. I enjoy  the Okra Stir Fry and Basmati Rice along with Onion Fries.  Did I mention the Naan? The Garlic Naan is my favorite! Hot and garlicky just the way I like it! I'm vegetarian so I don't do much meat. However my husband loves the Shrimp! We are regulars! We frequent often because of the good food and atmosphere. I also bring my co-works to enjoy the great food. They just love it as much as we do! If your in the area or mood for excellent Indian Food this is your place! You won't be disappointed... we never are!
reviews.name: Selina's

reviews.text: Great tasting food, the chicken tikka masala is really fantastic. The owner is usually here and is quite friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for great Indian food.
reviews.name: William

reviews.text:
This is the best Indian cuisine place I ever had in Las Vegas, new spot, clean, tasty, excellent service and they have lunch specials that s what I had and will definitely go back!
Give it a try you won't regret it!and yes 5 stars because it deserve 5 Stars!
reviews.name: Jasmine

reviews.text: I came here on a whim because I was nearby. I'm so glad I did! The food was amazing. I've had Indian food here and there and was never the biggest fan but this totally changed my mind. I ordered the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan and gulab jamum. Chicken tikka and naan was so delicious, I found myself raving about it to my friend after. It was a first time trying the jamum and it didn't disappoint. The service was also very good, very courteous. I was asked how my food was and if I needed anything multiple times, he really made sure to be attentive and make sure my food and experience was good. Place was nice and clean. Talented chef, amazing service.
reviews.name: Olivia

reviews.text:
This is a wonderful Indian restaurant, with very flavorful food. William, the chef and owner, is dedicated to his customers wants them to be happy healthy and successful!
The dahl is very flavorful, all of the dishes are excellent. Come over and try it out you won't be sorry! The prices are reasonable, service is great.
reviews.name: Robert

reviews.text: Came in for lunch and service was incredibly slow. Server was nice but slow. Would bring things out one at a time even the checks. The tikka masala sauce was so red that it looked like it was food dye. The chicken & lamb was tough. Even brought rice and naan way before the entree came so it got cold. Very disappointed.
reviews.name: S

reviews.text: Amaaaazzzzinnnnggg Food .Fresh & Delicious .. Paneer Tikka is fantastic .. Biryani is another WOW..
reviews.name: Priyanka

reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised by Paradise India - wow, the flavors were amazing!  I'm so used to the buffets around town, so hit and miss, that I may have forgotten how good it can get.  I ordered the lunch special with Korma and Tikka Masala and I've never tasted Korma that good.  I wanted to drink the sauce in a cup.  The naan, as stated in other reviews, is also unbelievably good.  At one point the owner/chef came out and asked us how everything was - letting us know he cooked our food.  Such a nice touch.  Support this place, it's delicious and now that I've had it, I'll be back regularly!
reviews.name: M

reviews.text:
Stopped​ here for a quick lunch, Chef William is currently #1 Indian Chef in Las Vegas. This comes from an Indian foodie​. The menu is pretty elaborate​ with a ​range of Indian cuisine across regions, unlike other restaurants which focus on North Indian only. 
I had the Masala Dosa, truly authentic​. Crispy, well-marinated​ dosa batter which has a ​slight tinge​ of butter. That is how it needs to be and most, in fact,​ all other restaurants​ don't get this right. The Masala was perfect, took my taste buds right to southern India. 
I will be back and try their Lamb Biryani, which Chef William is so famous for.
reviews.name: Bhushan

reviews.text:
My friends and I decided to try Paradise India on a Tuesday night. It was pretty dead for a week night with only two other customers on the other side of the restaurant. Our server was pretty nice though. She handled our group of 7 people's orders flawlessly and was constantly checking up on us. It took a while for our food to come out (I understand, big order) but she was letting us know that we will be served shortly.

The food was pretty good. I personally enjoyed the Tandoori Platter that had a bunch of different meats. I like variety and this was a great way to sample the different meats and flavor they offer. It was my first time trying a Peshwari Naan. I definitely liked this one due to its sweeter taste. It was a great contrast to most of the dishes we sampled.  

Overall our experience was positive. It was very kind of the chef to give us free desserts in the end! We appreciate the hospitality.

I do hope this place stays open, though I fear it might not. The plaza where it is currently at overall could use more business. I remember going here just to get Bachi but maybe a juice bar would do better here with a gym right next to it.
reviews.name: Joanna Marie

reviews.text: Food was great. We had a few vegetarian options. Being none vegetarian found them to be really good and light. Friends loved the lentil soup. Veggie samosas where great as well. Staff was really nice and took great care of us. Thanks we will be back again soon.
reviews.name: H.R

reviews.text:
The food is very tasty and I recommend the chicken Tika Masala and the garlic Naan. 
Service is great!
reviews.name: Eldoblej

reviews.text:
Our office tried this place today for catering & it was amazing!! I wish I had more photos but it was so good we ate it so quickly. From the second the food was brought in, it smelled so good. I used to drive across town for Indian food but I'm glad this is so close to us, I will 100% be back again. I'm always skeptical trying a new Indian place, but this food was delish. The chicken kabobs & chicken tikka specifically were my favorite. Not dry at all, like others I've had. I'll be back again to try more.

Bottom line, try this place!!
reviews.name: Alyssa

reviews.text: Phenomenal food and atmosphere!  Attentive staff and delicious food...definitely coming back!
reviews.name: Rodolfo

reviews.text:
I placed my order online for carryout, which is through GrubHub. I was given a 45 minute pickup time which I didn't think anything of for good food. 
5 minutes before my given carryout time, I arrived hoping it would be done early since my family was SO hungry. The sign and outside pillar had lights on but I noticed the windows seemed dark. I thought maybe they used blackout since it does get hot here in Vegas. Nope... CLOSED for the Holidays! Seriously?! My $80 order was allowed to be placed when then are on holiday? 
I had to call GrubHub to have them verify that the restaurant was indeed closed at the time and finally got my money back. 
I usually give places a few tries before leaving a bad review but not this time. It is poor business practice to not figure out how to turn off auto orders.
reviews.name: Tina

reviews.text: Been there at least four times over the last couple months, always great food and service. Probably the most reasonably priced Indian food in Vegas especially when you factor in the quality.
reviews.name: Steve

reviews.text: Went to Paradise India for the first time today after friends of mine frm Switzerland recommended it to me. I had the lunch special.  a  Chicken/Korma, Chicken/Curry combination with the best Naan Bread I ever had ! The sauces were rich and so flavorful ! I am so glad I went there and can't to go back !!
reviews.name: Silvia

reviews.text: Really great place. Really good lunch specials. Enjoyed it every time I go. We get the chicken korma and tikka masala. Won't disappoint. Fair price.
reviews.name: Roy

reviews.text: First time dinner at India's Flame last night. Many tables taken with a mix of folks. Nice atmosphere & very clean. Service was very appropriate for a buffet dinner. You do have any option for a la carte. The buffet has a salad offering, desserts, a lassi drink, 4 veg entrees & 4 non-veg entrees and a few side accompaniments. You also receive a good sized portion of plain or garlic naan. They have beer & wine. Everything was very fresh & had excellent taste. The nice feature on the buffet was that everything had a good description of the dish, for people that are unfamiliar with the tastes/ingredients, I think that is very helpful. The buffet table was filled & refilled while we were there. Nice leisurely pace. We will be returning.
reviews.name: Geri

reviews.text: The food is really tasty and service is fabulous, but If you're going for the buffet, think twice. I'm sure they put some baking soda in the buffet food to make you feel full. Me and my girlfriend went there and after 20 minutes we felt like omg we ate a lot but we hadn't. And when we left we both had digestion problems and gassy stomachs. It kinda ruined the rest of the night for us.
reviews.name: Pouria

reviews.text: Stopped in for lunch. This place is awesome!! Lunch and Dinner Buffet and a la carte entrees available. Everything was fresh and delicious! Clean atmosphere and ambiance. Friendly staff and great service! Apparently the owners use to run Guru Palace in Mesa and have over 30 years in the restaurant industry. Enjoy! If you love Indian food, you'll love India's Flame!! I'll be back!!
reviews.name: Daniel

reviews.text:
We were a party of three for their Buffet on a Thursday. 
The place is bright, modern looking and comfortable. Their are ample dishes available my only criticism was not all necessarily hot more like lukewarm. The flavors were spot on and having free tea and Mango drink was another bonus. Our servers all males were all so friendly and accommodating. Thank you Magic Man for coming to the recuse with the Chia Tea dispenser.

Coming even from the westside of Phoenix it's easily accessible from the 60. Well worth another visit.
reviews.name: Ma

reviews.text: This is a really great gem in Tempe! The food is delicious, the service is fast and friendly. I have not yet tried the buffet, only a la carte items. The chicken tikka masala is perfect. The aloo gobi is just layered with wonderful flavor and has more kick than I expected. This has become my go-to spot for Indian food in Tempe.
reviews.name: Eliana

reviews.text:
We took a chance on going here, as my English husband fancied some Indian food. In the UK, great Indian restaurants are everywhere, while they are less common in Arizona. We were pleasantly surprised. The menu has standard Indian classics, such as biryani and curries of all types, as well as naan and other breads, and is quite tasty. We ordered bhajis as a starter, then he had vindaloo and I had chicken biryani. The mint and cucumber sauces were yummy, as were our main dishes. The restaurant also has a buffet if you want to try a variety of dishes, which we plan to do for lunch one day. 

Portion sizes are quite good, we had leftovers to take home. 

The restaurant is a decent local spot for an evening dinner. We were there on a Friday night, while it was not super busy, it had a good flow of customers and people ordering takeout. It's still new and I do hope people continue to patronize India's Flame and keep it open. 

One thing to keep in mind is that their heat scale is 1 - 10. That would be Scottsdale 1 - 10, as a medium was actually quite mild and a 6 was less spicy than my husband expected. Not a problem, you can just tell your server you like spicy and they will adjust the heat to your liking. 

I do recommend this place - I want to try their tandoori chicken sometime, as well as other dishes.
reviews.name: Pati

reviews.text: Since Pasand went under in Tempe I've been looking for a place like this. This is by far the best Indian food in Tempe. So happy we stumbled upon it
reviews.name: Carrie

reviews.text: Me and a friend came in from out of town and decided we wanted to try this place out. We took advantage of the buffet and everything we tried was amazing. Our waiter was even kind enough to give us a to go box to sample more food since we were really full and headed back to Nevada. Food was absolutely amazing!!!
reviews.name: Taylor

reviews.text:
This place is a solid choice for Indian food. We were feeling like eating vegetarian that day so we went with the dal makhani (lentils) and Chana masala (chickpeas). They were both tasty but I wish they were a little spicier. Maybe that was my fault there was no spice because I ordered online and there was no spice option and I forgot to specify which spice level I wanted.

I enjoyed the naan and rice and samosas. The green samosa sauce was also nice but maybe a little watery (? I don't know if that's the word I'm looking for) for my tastes.

I would order here again although I wish there was more vegetarian and dairy-free options!
reviews.name: Mia

reviews.text: Amazing flavor and variety for the lunch buffet. The price is very fair for all the variety, and lots of tasty vegetarian options.
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text:
Once again Yelp didn't let me down. Wanted to try something different with the fam and decided on India's Flame. 

The place is spotless, and the buffet was outstanding. We all enjoyed it and for the price you can't beat it. 

We'll be going back!
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Decided to try the buffet (only $9.99), grabbed some chicken tikka Marsala, tandoori chicken, and fried fritters. Great environment, good service, and surprisingly fresh food!!!
reviews.name: Matt

reviews.text: I and an Indian food lover. This place just topped my favorite Indian restaurants in Arizona. Defiantly coming back for my Indian food cravings. I loved the buffet and my wife ordered off the menu. The food tasted fantastic and the customer service was top notch.
reviews.name: Clint

reviews.text: Excellent buffet option with a wonderful selection of both meat and vegetarian options.  Delicious authentic chai tea.  Well-lit dining area that is nicely decorated and clean.  Friendly, knowledgeable, attentive wait staff.  Very enjoyable dining experience!
reviews.name: Heather

reviews.text: Friendly place to eat a buffet Indian meal. Food is definitely spiced mildly (a plus for my family). There is a small, but good selection of items in the buffet. Everything was kept hot. The garlic naan was delicious! The mango lassi is nice in that it isn't very sweet. The rice pudding is also excellent--I love cardamom. Sometime I will come try things off the menu rather than the buffet.
reviews.name: Kay

reviews.text: Awesome Indian restaurant! All is perfect there. Place is really nice, extremely clean bathrooms, and  food is delicious. I have to mention how nice those folks are. We got in very late, close to closing and they treat us excellent. We did missed the buffet though, so the next day we returned and enjoyed. Highly recommended.
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text:
Been to this place on Thursday for buffet dinner-12.99$
 Like the ambience and staff. Disappointed with quality of food. 
I am very sure that none of the items on buffet was fresh. 
I was able to get that powder kind in Mango lassi. Tandoori chicken was a disaster.. lamb and biriyani and veg items were good. Again Chai was not like chai, it was like colored water.
reviews.name: Arpitha

reviews.text: This place has really nice ambience and feels surprisingly classy. Nice place to grab a quick lunch.
reviews.name: Cindy

reviews.text:
This is a pretty good option for Indian buffet at a reasonable price. I don't usually have very high expectations at Indian buffets because I find the quality to be lower than a la carte Indian food, but didn't experience that here. 

For vegetarians, there's a decent amount of options in the buffet. We tried the daal makhani, chole, and kadhi which were all pretty good. They also have a variety of meat curries, a couple desserts, and chai/mango lassi. The highlight of the meal was the naan though. They bring fresh garlic naan to your table and it has the right amount of flavor and fluff. It's so soft but doesn't taste raw at all. I wish I could eat that naan with chole endlessly. 

Overall, I'd come back here if I wanted Indian buffet because it's pretty fairly priced and tastes good too.
reviews.name: Nikita

reviews.text:
I found this place through yelp. It was funny, I work inside City Hall as security and I actually met the owner when they came to get their liquor license, I had no idea i was headed to the exact same people though! 

I had the buffet. Buffets can always be hit or miss but this buffet was fresh, piping hot and delicious. I'm so glad I chose this place, and I hope they continue to get the support they deserve!
Absolutely delicious, will definitely come back. 

Price is also extremely cheap. A+ quality.
reviews.name: Ethan

reviews.text: My new favorite Indian food place. The food is flavorful with out being overly spicy. Their mango lassi is light and less "artificial" than other buffets. It's clean well lite and the waitstaff is polite. I am totally coming back. Yum!
reviews.name: amanda

reviews.text: There are other reviews from last month that say lunch buffet was only $9.99, they have raised the price to $10.99, but it is still a great value.  Excellent food, very good flavors.  Quality-wise, I would compare it to Curry Garden in Gilbert (my standing Indian food favorite), and selection-wise it compares well to the nearby Chutney's.  Everything was tasty, and I had the whole buffet :)  Will definitely be back again and again.
reviews.name: Shawn

reviews.text: One word... AMAZING!  The lunch buffet had lots of options & was super reasonably priced. The Chicken Tikka Masala was perfect with just the right amount of spice.  A salad bar, 2 kinds of Naan, & Mango Lassi all included with the buffet.  I'm new to the Indian food scene & was really impressed with everything I tried, as were my friends that are more well versed in this cuisine. There is a regular menu as well, if you don't want to do the buffet, with tons of additional choices. They were able to accommodate our party of 12 without any issues...we did call ahead & it was all set up when we arrived. Right off the 60/Rural with easy parking...My new favorite lunch spot!
reviews.name: Kristy

reviews.text: Love this restaurant! Incredibly tasty food, great service, and kind waitstaff. Highly recommend.
reviews.name: Amelia

reviews.text: I have been here twice and I have to say I am addicted to this place!! The staff is so friendly and will answer any questions about the menu. I am vegan and they helped cater to my dietary needs! I get the palak paneer (veganized) with roti. The food is absolutely wonderful, if you are ever in the area you MUST try it out!
reviews.name: Nicole

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise. The dinner buffet was fresh and has several choices including  several vegetarian options.
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text:
Back for the 3rd time. This is the best Indian restaurant ever. They also offer dinner buffet. They keep everything fresh. Several chicken dishes, lamb, goat and more. Love their chai and mango lassi. Super clean interior and the ambience is awesome with Indian music playing in the background. 
Service is excellent.
reviews.name: Christine

reviews.text: My husband and I like to come here for their buffet on the weekends after he has had a long bike ride (he's an avid cyclist) and needs to calorie load. The food is fresh and flavorful, the ambiance is nice. They play upbeat Indian music and I find myself dancing along in my seat as I chow down. The naan is super yum and they keep it coming while you're eating, which is a plus. It's a pretty good bang for your buck (if you get the buffet), and since you self serve you can get in and out of there pretty quickly if you're in a hurry. I don't eat meat and they have a good selection of vegetarian dishes that keep me feeling like I'm winning too, and not left out because of my diet. The servers are nice, and the place is always clean and well kept. My only suggestion for them would be to check in patron's drink status frequently. The food is spicy, so you never want to hit the bottom of your glass, no matter what you're drinking! That being said we will definitely continue to visit India's Flame when we want spicy Indian food at a good price.
reviews.name: Raji

reviews.text: I went here on a Thursday evening & they had the full buffet or sit down dinner option. I choose Buffet after seeing it stocked full of their most popular dishes, all of which were very very tasty. Service was top notch & friendly and the entire place was very clean & professional. Bill came to just over $14.00 so I tipped very well. I can't say the food was incredible or I'd give it 5 stars but is was very very good. Would 100% go again next time I'm visiting
reviews.name: Tim

reviews.text:
The dinner buffet was terrific.  Amazing price ($12.99), great selection (4 vegetarian, 4 meat dishes, 3 appetizers, 2 desserts, lahsis and tea, all the greatest hits).  Each of the dishes was pretty darned good, well spiced and fresh.  Came with fresh basket of garlic naan (with free refills available).  Considering you can't buy a single entree in most Indian restaurants for under $13, this place was an incredible value.

The restaurant was very clean, new and comfortable.  The service was friendly and attentive (refills and plate refresh).

I'll be back whenever I'm in the mood for Indian food.
reviews.name: Tyler

reviews.text:
Friendly people . Makes for a perfect dining experience 

and the food is amazing !!
reviews.name: Jon

reviews.text: This was a new place for us.  The food was superb. The biggest buffet choice for Indian food.  They even had mango lassi on buffet line.  I didn't have enough stomach to try everything.  I was stuffed to my eye balls. Service was exceptional and we were attended to well. It was so satisfying we all commented how stuffed we were on the way home.  I took a 3 hour nap after that.
reviews.name: Christina

reviews.text: First time here.  Read the reviews, gave it a shot.  FANTASTIC!  Flavors are fantastic and the nighttime buffet is a sure fire hit!  Reminds me how Delhi Palace used to be many years ago.  Super friendly service!  If you like Indian food, you'll love this!
reviews.name: Xandra

reviews.text: Yum! Finally, we found a great Indian restaurant in the East valley! Reasonable and delicious, we enjoyed the buffet on Sunday. Great service too. Thank you Indian flame.
reviews.name: Maria

reviews.text: Excellent dinner buffet. The staff is very friendly. I definitely recommend this place.
reviews.name: Samuil

reviews.text: Delicious buffet. Great price. Everything was yummy and the people are so nice. We plan on going often!
reviews.name: H

reviews.text: Great customer service nice and clean place. food was good not great.. they had a buffet on Monday night not sure if it's an every night thing
reviews.name: Krissy

reviews.text:
Experience 5/5 - very friendly and prompt service; clean, attractive and well decorated restaurant; buffet well-stocked
Food 4/5 - good variety; very good food; full bar available
Value 6/5 - buffet with mango lassi, chai, naan and a great selection of dishes included for $12.99 at dinner? I've never seen anything this good!
reviews.name: Joe

reviews.text: We tried the place for the first time - flavors and quality were quite underwhelming. Gonna pass!
reviews.name: Div

reviews.text: This is one of my new favorite places to eat. The food is amazing and the service is top notch. When I entered I was greeted warmly and sat immediately. The buffet is fresh and very inviting. The only problem I have is that I don't have enough stomach to try everything! I would definitely reccomend thia place to anyone that enjoys Indian food.
reviews.name: Kent

reviews.text:
The ambience of this place is very beautiful. The service was very friendly. The portions were on the small side. 

We would return
reviews.name: Wade

reviews.text: A casual Indian restaurant, probably known most for its buffet. We however ordered al a carte and weren't impressed. The panner tikka masala did not have the tikka paneer so it was basically a normal masala panner. Malai kofta was okay. For breads we ordered the garlic nan and paneer nan, which were better than the gravy. The food over all was just okay.
reviews.name: Sonal

reviews.text: Best India food in town! Everything is fresh and buffet and menu option every day! Comes with the Indian mango yogurt drink and tea! We are now back for your Sunday bunch buffet after 41 hours when we first had diner here lol.
reviews.name: Han

reviews.text:
India's flame was on my radar ever since I was craving Indian food. After hiking South Mountain and walking around the Phoenix Arts Festival, my friend and I quickly grew for an appetite. Insert India's Flame as it was a perfect time to subdue my hunger for Indian food. Greeted by I believe the owner's son, and quickly was asked if I wanted regular or garlic naan bead. I love naan bead, so I chose to be adventurous and had the garlic naan. The garlic naan was hot, fresh, and delicious. Now to the buffet of foods. They serve the most distinguished dishes for their patrons to divulge in: chicken curry, chicken tandori, chicken, and goat marsala (my favorite, the goat was not hard or chewy, but fall of the bone tender). 

Also to add they serve mango lassi for a perfect touch to your meals. I wish they had better servings or variety of desserts as they only had rice pudding and fruits to consume. I had to ask for the gulab jamun, which the owner son was friendly enough to give. Overall the experience at India's Flame was good enough to warrant another visit. Plus you can't beat $12.99 for fresh and delicious Indian food!
reviews.name: Roger

reviews.text:
Went here today for the lunch buffet and was very satisfied! 

A basket of either plain or garlic naan is brought to the table with the buffet (and perhaps with a la carte, but - I would not know), and the garlic naan smelled and tasted Great, as well as the food on the buffet. What was a particularly unexpected delight was a dispenser of mango lassi at the buffet - I didn't try it b/c I was already Quite Full but I certainly will when I go back, assuming they have it again. 

The veg options were fairly standard for a North Indian lunch buffet - spinach, lentils, vegetable korma, rice - but very good versions. They were very low-spice, with some variation b/w options like - the spinach was super mild, whereas the korma was just hot enough to leave a pleasant heat at the back of the throat. 

I was also really delighted by their kheer - I really love kheer but haven't found it at most of the other Indian buffets I've checked at around/just outside Tempe, whereas the kheer here had a wonderful texture & a pleasant subtle taste of cardamom. 

My only kind of weird and very particular complaint is that I chose to sit at a table instead of a booth, b/c I'm a small person w/ a short torso and I often find that the distance b/w booth seat and table height is uncomfortable for me, but the chairs for the tables were also kind of high. But like, unless you're also short and weirdly proportioned you'll probably be fine, && human bodies vary so much I would never hold that against them at all.
reviews.name: Russel

reviews.text:
One of the best buffets I've ever had. Each dish was freshly prepared with homemade sauces and fresh ingredients, from the Goat Masala to the Paneer Masala and Palak Paneer.
Also, the Naan bread is fresh, well seasoned, and perfectly cooked.
reviews.name: Samuel

reviews.text: We drove by 4 other Indian restaurants today to try this place and were not disappointed.  Excellent flavors and great service.  The buffet was fresh with a good selection of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. It's on a smaller side but the quality compensates.  Will come back
reviews.name: Irina

reviews.text: I have been to a handful of Indian restaurants in the valley, and so far this is my favorite one! Buffet had a great variety and the spices were just right.  Service was quick and extremely friendly, always Johny on the spot to take my dirty dish or fill my water cup.  They didn't have their alcohol license at the time, but now they do! Will definitely be back for a Taj Mahal to go with the excellent food!
reviews.name: Nathan

reviews.text:
Another Indian restaurant that offers lunch AND dinner buffet!? I'm in curry heaven!

They offer some flamin' hot deals here for both lunch and dinner which includes mango lassi and chai tea. The buffet had a good variety of items. Some dishes I remember at the dinner buffet were goat curry, chicken curry, chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, aloo gobi, tandoori chicken, and dal. There's also an area with salad, soup, and what appeared to be some chaat. For dessert there was kheer, mango pudding, and carrot halwa. 

You will also get freshly baked naan brought to your table, your choice of garlic or plain. We got the garlic naan and it was tasty! It went well with the other buffet items. 

The mango lassi was a nice balance of creamy and tangy flavors.

As for the spice level, you won't need to channel Johnny Storm to Flame On, for the dishes at the buffet here ranged from mild to maybe medium. 

The decor is quite an improvement over the last business here which was Pitalicious. It looks like they've done quite a bit of remodeling to turn this space into a beautifully designed spot.

Service was warm and friendly.

The buffet won't be burning any holes in your pocket, for the lunch price is $8.99 and dinner will run you $12.99.
reviews.name: Karen

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food! The "Butter Chicken" was incredible. We had the "curry chicken", "tiki-masala" and "butter chicken" all fantastic. Great atmosphere and helpful staff . Don't forget to order the garlic nan bread!
reviews.name: Marshall

reviews.text: This place is sometimes inconsistent, but always good tasty food! Would recommend the Madras chicken and the biryani. You could ask them to make the chicken dishes boneless too.
reviews.name: Satish

reviews.text: We went three times and it was disappointing.. half cooked rice and half cooked chicken came all times. they are in hurry to serve i guess. even the rice is like masala rice not cooked well.. compared to biryani bites this is very bad ...
reviews.name: Suresh

reviews.text:
Best Indian food in the valley... great taste!! 

Place could have been bigger for the number of crowd coming in.
reviews.name: Snigdha

reviews.text:
When I went there first time, I didn't get a place to sit after waiting for 45 minutes so I was bit disappointed.

But next time, my experience was good.  Chicken Biryani was very good with moderate waiting time, but it's too early make any opinion on food or waiting because the place is new. It's gonna be the best place for Biryani if they could maintain the food quality.

Currently they are serving only Biryani, Curry & Rice "NO Bread".
reviews.name: Prakhar

reviews.text:
Wife and I went there today because next door is a top-notch vacuum repair place.  We decided to visit this restaurant for the first time.  Boy!!! Are we glad we did.  Very clean.  Hostess/waitress was very accommodating and helpful as we deciphered the menu items.
This is not a buffet but a restaurant having a list of lunch items.  Each dish comes as either vegetarian, chicken, or goat.  Wife had chicken and I had goat.  Both meats fell off the bone.  Was a bit spicy but not all that bad.  Each lunch special came with a appetizer, main course with nan, and a dessert. We both loved our meals and we'll be back.
reviews.name: Dave

reviews.text:
3.5 stars

Ordered pickup, which was ready within 30min.

The biryani rice was unexpectedly soft. Ordered the boneless chicken dum biriyani, garlic nann, and paneer tikka masala which were great.  Gotta love these hole in wall spots.
reviews.name: Em

reviews.text:
Our dinner at Paradise biryani point was an unforgettable experience, worth the wait.

We started with some chilli chicken and paneer appetizers, which were delicious and reminded me of my favorite restaurants back in India.

For my main course we had ordered chicken biryani and I must say i wasn't disappointed and the mirchi ka salan was to die for.

5 stars for the delicious food and impressive service. Best biryani and starters in Arizona hands down.
reviews.name: Siddhartha

reviews.text: Most authentic biryani till date in the valley ! Loved their special chicken dum biryani ! If I eat here I do not crave for Indian food , as it's super authentic !!!! Love it
reviews.name: P

reviews.text: I have been waiting for this place to open in the valley and it is worth the wait. I have tried biryani in all the Indian restaurants in the valley. This is by far the most decent biryani in phoenix. The gravy that comes with the biryani was right on. That's how you know they are here to stay for a long time.
reviews.name: Ram

reviews.text:
Good choice of biriyani in the north valley, there weren't many. First week so they were busy with lot of wait, I decided to skip the lines and ordered to go. 
This is probably best biryani in Arizona but since this is a chain let me compare them with their other locations in California.
I tried their goat biriyani in Santa Clara, Fremont and Artesia CA...so let me highlight why this biryani was a let down....there was hardly any meat! Dum biriyani is known for meat..they included more rice to fill the void! Less meat and masala the biriyani hardly tastes like one.
Compared to other locations they did not include slice of egg and fried onions as well. I hope they improve and maintain the consistency of their other locations 
Good luck guys don't let me down the next time on meat!
reviews.name: Venkesh

reviews.text: Went here tonight and was very surprised that it was empty. I don't understand.  The food is wonderful. One of the better Indian restaurants in the valley. I haven't had a meal that wasn't exceptional.
reviews.name: William

reviews.text:
Outstanding biryani's and appetizers 
Strongly recommend this point for authentic hyderabadi delicacies  

The staff is very warm and welcoming, 
prices are great food is even more great
reviews.name: Solomon

reviews.text: Not up to the hype. Food taste and quality is not even average. Prepared to be disappointed.
reviews.name: Harry

reviews.text: This is the third time I am posting my review and every single time they delete it because my review is not in their favor.. I am sorry to say but the biryani is not authentic, i have tried biryani at their california location. There is no comparission at all. Very less quantity for the price. I ordered appatizer and there was not meat but just flour in the dish.. I hope they don't delete this review again..
reviews.name: N

reviews.text: Very nice food.. I have tried many items and all were upto expectation.. Staff is very polite and courteous.
reviews.name: Amrita

reviews.text:
We ordered food for my little one's birthday party and food was great. Received so many compliments from guests for their biryani, veg kadai and babycorn manchuria.
Thanks to Mahesh, manager at this restaurant for taking care and sending delicious food to the party...
reviews.name: Mouni

reviews.text:
Best biryani in Phoenix
I have tried many of their appetizers and paradise special chicken biryani multiple times panning several months and I have to say it's been super delicious , authentic and very consistent .
reviews.name: Ever

reviews.text: Nice place. Mainly a take away joint. Over all Good food. Goat Haidarabadi Masala and Goat Biryani are too good. They have good Dosa and Sambar.
reviews.name: Vivek

reviews.text: Awesome biryani. Can relate to the authentic taste from Hyderabad. Small but clean. Staff is awesome . My thumbs up for the same in North Phoenix and Glendale locations.
reviews.name: Abhisek

reviews.text: I love this place, it is a goto spot for fresh and great tasting Indian cuisine.  I have been here about 10 times and always love it.  The dishes are served hot and the spice levels can be tailored to any pallet.  The staff is very friendly and we have never disappointed.  I look forward to my next visit.
reviews.name: Matt

reviews.text:
The only thing which was good was goat chukka, rest all the chicken and veg dishes was pathetic. Quality of chicken was very bad and not cooked, Veg appetizer is also bad.

Briyani chicken is not good. Goat is ok.
reviews.name: Ravi

reviews.text: Paradise is a chain that works on a franchise basis. This particular franchise is one of the worst I have encountered. The server, as polite as he was, needs training on how to do the job he has signed up to do. He had answers for none of my questions and in the end, I felt misguided about the choice I made due to lack of information about the entree. Service was nothing to write home about and the food was nothing exciting. Sorry folks, dining at your place was a very ordinary experience.
reviews.name: Ramen

reviews.text: NASTY ... the smell from the food emanates to the apartments ... I thought, give it a chance, try the food, I did, NASTY.  Never again, can't wait until they go under and go bye bye!
reviews.name: Rhonda

reviews.text:
Let me start by saying how excited i was when i heard that paradise had come to the valley.
I drove a good 30 minutes from Scottsdale just to get a taste of my favorite biryani.
The Dum Biryani is something that Paradise always gets right but compared to the others in California especially Santa Clara this one is a let down.
It tastes nothing like the biryani one expects from a chain like Paradise (no fried onions and the flavor of the rice was just average).The Spice level i asked for was Medium but the biryani was too hot to handle.
The raita and mirchi ka salan were fine.This is not the quality one expects from Paradise,the biryani tasted like something you would get at an average Indian restaurant.

Definitely not worth the Drive or the Hype.

Cheers!
reviews.name: Pratishruti

reviews.text: This review is hoping that you will improve with respect to quality and do not play with customers health. Last Saturday I ordered Goat dum Biryani, chicken 65 and naan. Biryani and Chicken 65 definitely not cooked on that day. It felt so dry and they taste like they just got it out of refrigerator and warmed it up. Only the naan and kadai paneer curry somewhat better. It's so stupid to spend 50$ on this. And the worst part is serving this food to guests who arrived on that night. All the food is in trash. One of the guests had stomach pain. Atleast for the money please promise a little quality food.
reviews.name: Chakradhar

reviews.text:
I didn't want to stop here because of the ratings but was outvoted by my friends.  Clean, nice atmosphere and fast service.  The Dosa is amazing ++.  Chicken Tika Masala and the Buttered Chicken were also delicious. We had a veggie dish with cauliflower and potatoes~great too.
This is an undiscovered hidden gem.  Loved it.
reviews.name: Rosemarie

reviews.text:
This was my 4th visit to this place. Always loved this place, but this time it was a disaster. Usually I order biriyani, but this time tired non-veg thali.. where is non veg in Thali ? No taste, just the yellow dal was good that's it!! Will never try anything other than biriyani here! 
Also, found hair in curd and Lassi, the grumpy server did not even say sorry.. he walked away like a robot.
reviews.name: Arpitha

reviews.text: Go to this place if you want the real deal on biryani. I can bet no one comes close to what they make here . I ordered vegetable biryani and can't get enough of it. As far as buffet or North Indian food and such, go there at your own risks. Hyderabadi making Punjabi food ... just doesn't fit right. Anyways stick with biryani and you will feel the same !!! Keep it up guys , Wil be back for some chicken biryani this time
reviews.name: yatin

reviews.text: I have tried 2 times. For Chicken Biryani, Rice is more cooked than required. No way, it's close to Hyderabad Paradise Biryani.
reviews.name: Ravi

reviews.text: Went in for dinner and the food was fantastic! Ordered the chicken tikka masala and the chettinaad chicken curry with some somosas, everything came out on point. Will definitely be returning!
reviews.name: LeaLynn

reviews.text: Great food. We ordered the Chicken Masala, Biryani Chicken rice, and garlic naan. Service was great and restaurant is clean!
reviews.name: Desiree

reviews.text: Hands down Best Biryani in Phoenix Area .
reviews.name: Arnab

reviews.text: Would highly recommend Paradise Biryani Pointe. The food was amazing and the restaurant was very clean and pleasant. Our waiter Uma Mahesh was very nice and friendly. Go try them out!
reviews.name: Shawn

reviews.text:
Amazing biryani and can't really get better than this.

Although the wait times were high early on, the service on my latest visit has improved leaps and bounds.

I definitely recommend visiting this place for biryani and appetizers along with the best mirchi ka salan ever!
reviews.name: Anvesh Reddy

reviews.text: The prices have gone up, the amount of substantial food has gone down. Its delicious, but I am considering not returning again. Sorry - but this is not a good business model. I understand increasing prices but when you decrease the quantity of food as well, this is ridiculous.
reviews.name: Shamim

reviews.text: FANTASTIC AUTHENTIC "Desi" Biryani. Outside India?? Want home-cooked Biryani? Great, polite service??? Visit Paradise Biryani Point & be thrilled!!! Never disappointed....
reviews.name: Nash

reviews.text: This place was amazing! Everything to both the chicken and goat curries served with the rice and the garlic naan were just amazing ! Creating that spicy balance ! The mango lassi was amazing as well! Definitely will come back!
reviews.name: Yesenia

reviews.text: This is probably the best Indian thali I have had in the Phoenix area. The varieties and flavor matches exactly to how Indian food should be cooked . Best things to eat here are the chicken dum biryani / non veg thali / goat curry / garlic naan
reviews.name: P

reviews.text: Chicken dum briyani is on point. So good haven't ordered anything else & went for take out two nights in a row. Staff were friendly; food was hot and was ready on time as promised.
reviews.name: Tu

reviews.text:
Was a very good value.  Co diner had ginger shrimp ,like it a lot
I had mixed plate but can't remember which one.that brings me to my 4 not five stars. I do not speak nor read Indian. Menu needs  better descriptions in English. Meal was very tasty. I was impressed that it was a chain/franchise restaurant.
reviews.name: Jake

reviews.text: Best restaurant in d valley for hyderabadi biriyani taste. We tried Gongura Goat biriyani and it tastes awesome. We also ordered a tray for couple of times for our parties and they maintained the same quality while we dine-in
reviews.name: Hari

reviews.text: I went like 2 times first week the restaurant was open and it was really crowded and we went today at 12.30pm and they even don't have biryanis available. The worst Indian restaurant in Phoenix- I am very sad to say this.
reviews.name: Babu

reviews.text: This place is great one of tha best chicken tiki masala I've ever had ! Delicious food and flavor was on point  garlic non-bread was delicious!! I highly recommend this place
reviews.name: Angelo

reviews.text: Tasty! Can never go wrong with this choice of cuisine , restaurant and service ! Will keep coming back !
reviews.name: Yesenia

reviews.text: This place has some amazing biryani, curries and desserts. I visit at least a few times a week for my Indian food cravings. Authentic Hyderabad style cooking !
reviews.name: Rahul

reviews.text: Restaurant opens @11am, but none of the items are ready until 12.30pm. What's the point?  People didn't get V. Biriyani till 1 pm or later, they keep saying slight delay..taste is also not good..
reviews.name: Sivaraman

reviews.text:
Nice Indian authentic taste. Affordable prices! We usually take biryani to go and order biryani in bulk in weekend gatherings and occasions. Biryani has never failed in taste and South Indian authenticity except in few cases when they initially started business at this location.

We heard about new entries in their menu and wanted to try. We revisited to try Maharaja Bhojanam. This item has got a Thali with veg, non veg curries and fries with one roti accommodated along with white rice and biryani. Also, came with a spicy papad and a desert. Apart from all this tasty stuff, treated with a freshly made sweet paan, which I liked the most and bought 5 of them for my family. Got a glass of butter milk with sides like yogurt and dal. It is hard to get this kind of treatment and I think it beats the price, taste and quantity against a buffet as long as Paradise maintains and keeps this bundle always. 

Keep it up, Paradise!
reviews.name: Jagan

reviews.text:
Probably the longest I have waited for a to-go.
50 mins and counting..
They better make the greatest biryani ever in the world.
reviews.name: Uday

reviews.text:
Great service for sure!  The food is good, but don't order hot unless you can handle eating a jalapeno raw...whew!  Food came out really quick and is super fresh--a certain plus.
We had the butter chicken which was delicious, so we heartily recommend it.  Also had a chicken biryani which was good--and I did notice that the native S. Indian types eating there ordered it, too, so it must be the common dinner food in India.  It was good, but mine was to be mild but tasted medium.  
The dosa we ordered was really good.  Looks like a huge pizza crepe with spinach and potato in it and 3 different sauces to dip it in.
We liked the place.  The food was good, the service was, too.  We'll be back!

P.S.  You know the place is good if you are the only White people in there and the rest are natives of their country's area.
reviews.name: Lucky

reviews.text: The Biriyani was good and the chicken65 .The only place where which provides a whole boiled egg in biriyani
reviews.name: Bhairy

reviews.text: This is the best Indian food i have had in North America and quite possibly outside of India. When you walk into this small cozy restaurant the sweet scent of curry and cardomon flirts with your senses. Abdul was my waiter and was very attentive. A very friendly gentleman from Bangeldesh who likes people, especially those that chat! I ordered chicken tikka (comes with a small salad) and onion bahji (a personal fav) for appetizers; chicken korma, garlic naan and basmati rice for the main course. Wow! I have never been able to find a korma that comes this close to what i had in India. Presentation was different but the flavour was bang on. I was so happy with my choice of restaurants, so many to pick from. This one was just on the other side of the mall from my hotel so a quick walk from the quality inn. I will make every effort to stay here again just for another dinner like that! Oh and i also had the mango Lassi, delicious. I felt the price was fair given the portion sizes. I was unable to eat all of it and was delighted to be able to take some home with me!
reviews.name: Jessie

reviews.text: I used to come here for their decent food for brossard standard, but the service is so bad that i cannot recommand this restaurant anymore. The waiters are slow and unprofessional. We flagged one down from the cash registered, he just nodded at us, then went to the kitchen, returns at the cash and answers the phone that just rang! Totally ignored us! Will not be returning.
reviews.name: Yi

reviews.text:
Amazing food by this charming family-run restaurant. 

This is about as good as it gets for indian food on the south shore and even stacks up against similar offerings on-island.

The service can be atrociously slow and somewhat cold but really it's kind of what makes the experience. It's the Seifeld soup-kitchen of montreal indian food: You despise going and waiting every time because you're slightly fearful of some of the staff but once the food arrives it warms your soul. 

*DO NOT* come here if you want quick-indian. Waiting for the food on an empty stomach is one of the sickest intellectual see-saw mind games any man can put themselves through: It's a sick game between the compounding desire to scream in a fit of hunger-fueled rage and the cultural norm of sitting quietly hunched-over with your arms tightly folded across your stomach in some sort of cro-magnon survival tactic. 

Either way the food is excellent and I highly recommend the saag paneer and chicken tikka. 

-Reserve on fridays and saturdays as they fill up fast.
reviews.name: Alexander

reviews.text: Savoureux. Petit resto. Service médium.
reviews.name: Marie-Eve

reviews.text: Being of Indian origin, having grown up on Indian food, and since I've frequented my fair share of Indian restaurants in and around Montreal, I'd say I'm in a position to judge Indian food from an informed standpoint.  In my opinion, this restaurant offers delicious Indian food.  Apart from the food, the service is absolutely outstanding.  The delightful people who work here will treat you like a guest of honor.
reviews.name: Sharm

reviews.text: Have stopped eating here as service and food has gone downhill. Orders often missing a dish and seem that pushing alcohol is main aim.
reviews.name: Fitzy

reviews.text:
Every once in a while I get flashbacks of the takeout I had from Tandoor. I'm not sure if it was because the food was exceptional or because I haven't had Indian in awhile, but regardless, it must be a good thing.

One weekday lunch, while in the area I stopped in to get a takeout thali plate, as a way to try out the place. The staff were pleasant, and the food tasty, so I'll definitely be back to try eating in sometime.
reviews.name: Amanda

reviews.text:
I ordered take out from Le Tandoor. I waited in the dining space as they prepared my order. The place was clean and pretty busy with locals. I got my order pretty quickly. Packaging was great- they put my food in styrofoam containers and then in a box to ensure nothing falls.

Quality of food was poor: samosa chaat 6$-1/5 was just 3 broken samosas with sprinkled salad and yogurt on the side, Shahi paneer 10$ -1/5 It more looked like a tomato soup, fairly small amount of food, paneer was too crumbly, the sauce was made of corn starch instead of a creamy sauce; the regular naan 3$ 2/5 way too small; the salad which is so basic was the only good thing about this meal.

For a quick Indian fix I wouldn't even go here.
reviews.name: Norine

reviews.text: We ordered take out...it took two hours before we realized it wasn't going to be delivered. Asked for a refund. Owner gave us a hard time for the refund. Terrible
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text:
This review is for their take-out service.

I came one day for take-out. As I entered, there were a few employees near the cash register. I came up to one of them and asked if they offered take-out. I got a very rude glance as if I had interrupted their conversation. The man (perhaps the owner) gave me a very long and roundabout answer, but basically yes they do offer take-out. It seemed as if they did not want my business. When I asked how much time it was going to take if I were to order butter chicken (14$) and naan bread (2$), he paused and thought for a while, and then answered, "It's going to take at least 30 minutes" as if to dissuade me from ordering. At this point, I was already there, so I decided to just go ahead and order, as 30 minutes wasn't going to kill me. Finally, the order literally took 3 minutes, not 30!

When I left, I realized the lid of the meal was not sealed properly and my bag was leaking, and there were no utensils. As much as I love Indian food, I will not be going back.
reviews.name: Maximilian

reviews.text:
Excellent food and the staff is really nice! The portions are very big. The lunch special is $15 tips and taxes included and is delicious (and super filling!!!) 
Would go back there anytime
reviews.name: Reetu

reviews.text:
Summary: 
The service here was very attentive, we felt like they were doing their utmost to make sure we had a wonderful and memorable experience. 

The food was absolutely delicious, and those portion sizes were perfect for sharing. 

Fantastic way to spend an evening eating great food as a group.

Long Version:
We were a party of 8 the evening that I went to Le Tandoor for dinner. The staff was very accommodating and offered us a proposal that wasn't already present on the menu, since it seemed that many of us simply couldn't decide what we'd like from the plethora of delicious sounding options on the menu. 

As someone who enjoys sampling a wide variety of dishes, their solution to this plight seemed perfect. The came out with such a wide variety of things to try. Crisp and plump samosas, savoury onion bhadgi, tender chicken tikka, steaming and tart mixed veg, steaming basmati, AMAZING naan, still sizzling chicken tikka masala, and let's not forget creamy butter chicken, among other things. The server was even kind enough to dish out the sizzling hot chicken tikka masala himself to avoid having us pass around a really hot dish (thus avoiding a potential disaster :p).

The thing that really got me though was when I spotted chicken dopiaza on the menu (something I find so rarely in Indian restaurants!). Upon mentioning my excitement, the kind server promised he would work it into the mix. It did not disappoint. If you're an onion fan, don't miss their chicken dopiaza!
